0.title: Pelosi highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine after war, Zelenskyy shares video
0.article_body: US Speaker of the House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi has become the highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine since the war with Russia began. Pelosi met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sharing a video of Pelosi's visit on Twitter, Zelenskyy wrote, "The United States is a leader in Ukraine's strong support in the fight against Russian aggression."

1.title: 32-year-old man arrested for harassing woman in Mumbai
1.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a man (32) for allegedly harassing and passing lewd comments at a woman (28) in the city's Andheri (West) area. The accused, identified as Govind Chavan, whistled at the complainant and later, commented on the complainant's dress when he was confronted by her, she alleged. Notably, Chavan's lawyer has claimed that the accused has been "falsely implicated".

2.title: 1 killed, several injured in shooting at US’ Mississippi festival
2.article_body: One person was reportedly killed and several others were injured in a shooting incident that took place at the Mississippi Mudbug Festival in the US. According to Hinds County Sheriff Tyree Jones, several people with unknown injuries were taken to hospitals. The event, being hosted at the Mississippi State Fairgrounds, includes live entertainment, cooking contests and amusement park rides.

3.title: If you offered me all the Bitcoin in the world for $25, I wouldn't take it: Buffett
3.article_body: Warren Buffett, the world's sixth richest person and Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, said if someone offered him all of the Bitcoin in the world for $25, he wouldn't take it. "What would I do with it? I'd have to sell it back to you one way or another," the 91-year-old added. Buffett also said that Bitcoin doesn't produce anything tangible.

4.title: Blake Lively to make film directorial debut with adaptation of 'Seconds'
4.article_body: American actress Blake Lively is all set to make her feature film directorial debut with an adaptation of the graphic novel 'Seconds', by Scott Pilgrim creator Bryan Lee O'Malley. Last year, Blake helmed the music video for Taylor Swift's 'I Bet You Think About Me', which received an Academy of Country Music Award nomination for Video of the Year.

5.title: I might be GT captain, but there's no hierarchy in team: Hardik Pandya
5.article_body: After registering their eighth win from nine games in IPL 2022, GT captain Hardik Pandya said he couldn't have asked for a better debut season for the franchise. "I don't like to grow as an individual. I like to grow with my teammates...That's the reason [for] our success as well...I might be the captain, but there's no hierarchy," he added.

6.title: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, 3 containment zones emerge in Bengaluru
6.article_body: Three containment zones have been reported in Bengaluru. Two containment zones have been reported in Mahadevapura and one in Bengaluru South. Reports said that the city had over 100 containment zones during the third COVID-19 wave. The Karnataka government has also instructed officials to start surveillance measures for those arriving from Japan and Thailand.

7.title: GST collection hits all time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022
7.article_body: The GST revenue collection for April 2022 was at its highest ever at ₹1.68 lakh crore, Finance Ministry said. It's ₹25,000 crore more than the next highest collection of ₹1,42,095 crore in March 2022. Of the ₹1.68 lakh crore collected in April 2022, CGST is ₹33,159 crore, SGST is ₹41,793 crore, IGST is ₹81,939 crore and cess is ₹10,649 crore.

8.title: KGF: Chapter 2's Hindi version crosses ₹350-crore mark
8.article_body: The Hindi version of Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has crossed the ₹350-crore mark at the box office. It is the tenth film in Hindi to cross the ₹300-crore mark, and the first to do so after the COVID-19 pandemic began. The film also stars Sanjay Dutt, Srinidhi Shetty, Raveena Tandon and Prakash Raj.

9.title: Ant-Man 3 to release on Feb 17, The Marvels to hit theatres on July 28
9.article_body: The release dates of Marvel Studios' 'The Marvels' and 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania' were swapped by Disney on Friday. 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania', previously scheduled to release on July 28, 2023, will now release on February 17. The release date of 'The Marvels', the sequel to 'Captain Marvel', has been moved to July 28, 2023 from February 17.

10.title: 5 people attacked me, beat me up with sticks and clubs: Influencer Kili Paul
10.article_body: Tanzanian influencer Kili Paul, who is known for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, took to Instagram Stories and revealed that he was attacked by five people. He added that he suffered an injury on his right thumb after a knife attack. "I got 5 stitches and I was beaten by sticks and clubs," he wrote.

11.title: Man flashes private parts at women, tries to hold their hands at Mangaluru mosque
11.article_body: A 26-year-old man in Karnataka's Mangaluru has been arrested for allegedly flashing his private parts at women inside a mosque. The accused has been identified as Sujith Shetty. Shetty entered the mosque and tried to hold the hands of several women and misbehaved with them and even flashed his private parts at them and disrupted the programme, said police officers.

12.title: SP MLA assaults power station worker over outage in UP; booked
12.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Ashutosh Maurya and his supporters have been booked for allegedly assaulting a power sub-station operator in UP's Budaun. Maurya reportedly claimed that he visited the station after receiving complaints about power outage from local residents. A video that surfaced on social media showed the MLA misbehaving with the operator, said police.

13.title: Suryakumar hugs angry Chahal to console him over DRS call, video goes viral
13.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav hugged RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal to console him after Umpire's Call in the DRS denied him Suryakumar's wicket in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. In a video that went viral, Chahal seemed angry after the review. "I didn’t tell him anything and it was just a sweet banter between him and me," Suryakumar later said.

14.title: 53,942 loudspeakers removed, sound level of 60,295 reduced: UP Police
14.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police said that they have removed 53,942 loudspeakers from various religious places till 7:00 am on Sunday. "The sound level of 60,295 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters," Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) in Uttar Pradesh, Prashant Kumar said. Districts had earlier been asked to submit a compliance report.

15.title: Hardik has been better than many great batters at the moment: Harbhajan
15.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said Hardik Pandya can bat at number three or four for Team India and there's no need for him to be sent down the order. "Hardik has been better than many other great batters at the moment...You can have someone else as a finisher," stated Harbhajan. Currently, Hardik is the third-highest scorer in IPL 2022.

16.title: I'm in a happy space with Shivashish; don't want to jump into marriage: Zareen
16.article_body: When asked about her wedding plans with her boyfriend, former Bigg Boss contestant Shivashish Mishra, actress Zareen Khan said no marriage is on the cards. "I've realised that Shiv is very similar to me, the kind of person I am," she added. "I'm in a very happy space with Shivashish right now; I don’t want to jump...into marriage," Zareen said.

17.title: Bombay HC upholds life-term of Pune man who stabbed aunt 54 times
17.article_body: Bombay High Court has upheld a session court's order sentencing a 33-year-old man from Pune to life imprisonment on charges of murdering his maternal aunt by stabbing her 54 times. The accused had claimed that no motive had been attributed to him for committing the crime. The accused was 21 years old at the time of the murder.

18.title: Want to do films that justify the time I'll spend away from my child: Anushka
18.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma said that she has always been a "seeker of balance" in her work and personal life. She added, "I will always want to be a part of the best scripts that come my way." Anushka said she's focusing on the scripts that will make it worth her time to stay away from her daughter Vamika.

19.title: Bengaluru police help take man who fell unconscious to hospital
19.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Namma 112 on Saturday tweeted that police officers have helped deliver an unidentified man, who is in his 30s, to a hospital after they found that he had fallen unconscious. The officers had arrived at the spot after receiving information that a man was seen lying on the road. The officers had immediately called an ambulance.

20.title: Most undertrials are poor, should get bail wherever possible: PM
20.article_body: PM Narendra Modi appealed to the Chief Ministers of states and the Chief Justices of High Courts to prioritise cases of undertrials. "There are over 3.5 lakh prisoners in jails who are undertrials. A majority of these are poor or from ordinary families," said PM Modi. Bail must be granted to them wherever possible, he added.

21.title: 'Pan-India' is a disrespectful word for movies, it should be removed: Actor Siddharth
21.article_body: Talking about several regional films being referred to as 'pan-India films', actor Siddharth said, "Pan-India is a very disrespectful word." He added, "The term is being used to describe that a regional film means there is something called an Indian film, which comes from Bollywood." "The term pan-India should be removed...it should just be called an Indian film," Siddharth stated.

22.title: Andrew Garfield confesses he was texting friends after Will slapped Chris at Oscars
22.article_body: Andrew Garfield has admitted he was texting friends after Will Smith slapped presenter Chris Rock during the 2022 Academy Awards.  He said, "Everyone's texting me, asking me, like, what the vibe in the room is. At that moment, my friends took priority over Kevin." Notably, Kevin Costner was introducing the director nominees when Garfield was pictured texting on his phone.

23.title: Some people giving communal colour: Tejashwi on loudspeaker row
23.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around the use of loudspeakers in religious places, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that some people are giving a "communal colour to unnecessary issues". "I want to ask a question...They (loudspeakers) were invented in 1925 and have been used in temples and mosques...since the 1970s. Didn't God exist when loudspeakers were not there?" Yadav tweeted.

24.title: Patiala clash 'mastermind' Barjinder Singh Parwana arrested from Mohali
24.article_body: Barjinder Singh Parwana, the alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Patiala, has been arrested. Range Inspector General MS Chhina said that Parwana was arrested from Mohali. A clash had broken out between members of Shiv Sena, who had called for an 'anti-Khalistan' march, and Sikh activists and Nihangs outside the Kali Mata temple.

25.title: Win means a lot, it hasn't been easy for us, we need to stick together: Ishan
25.article_body: MI opener Ishan Kishan has said their win against RR "means a lot" as it hasn't been easy for them in the ongoing IPL season. "We need to stick together...Hopefully, we win a few more matches," he added. On his 26-run innings, Ishan said, "Intent was to get boundaries in the powerplay to make it easier for the other batters."

26.title: 26-yr-old man steals 4 litres of milk from shop in Delhi, arrested
26.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing four litres of milk from a shop in Delhi's Kalkaji area on Saturday. Police said that the shopkeeper saw the man stealing four packets of milk and caught him red-handed. The shopkeeper then called the police, handed the man over and gave a written complaint.

27.title: Angelina Jolie rushes to bomb shelter in Ukraine amid air raid warning, video surfaces
27.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Angelina Jolie running towards a bomb shelter after an air raid siren went off in Ukraine's Lviv amid war with Russia. In the video, Jolie can be seen rushing out of a building with a group and saying, "I'm okay" to the camera. Earlier, she was filmed at a cafe, meeting some locals.

28.title: I was blown away by Sonali's bald look, asked Ayushmann 'Can I shave': Tahira
28.article_body: When asked what was the inspiration behind her bald look after her cancer treatment, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said she was blown away by Sonali Bendre's bald look after the latter's chemotherapy. "I was...34 when I saw that and I thought, 'What a woman'," she added. "So, when this was happening...I asked Ayushmann if I should shave," Tahira added.

29.title: 'What's the obsession with lip-syncing?' Twitter user asks Diljit, he responds
29.article_body: Singer Diljit Dosanjh responded to a Twitter user who accused him of lip-syncing during one of his performances at a concert. "What's the obsession with lip-syncing?" the user wrote while reacting to a video of Diljit performing at the Born To Shine World Tour in Jalandhar. "Lip Syncing...WTH? It's live, man. Don't disrespect the musicians," Diljit responded.

30.title: 21-yr-old rape accused jumps off Faridabad court building, dies
30.article_body: A 21-year-old man, accused of rape, jumped from the sixth floor of a court building and died in Faridabad after his bail plea hearing on Saturday. The deceased was arrested last year for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor. He had secured an interim bail later. His father claimed that the girl's parents were demanding money from him.

31.title: Karnataka man makes wife burn camphor on hand in 'fidelity test'
31.article_body: The police have launched a search for a man who allegedly forced his wife to burn camphor on her hand in a "fidelity test" in Veerenahalli village in Karnataka's Kolar. The police were informed about the matter after the head of an NGO got involved. The wife reportedly had not complained due to fear of retribution from her husband.

32.title: 18-year-old nurse found hanging from hospital wall in UP's Unnao, family allege rape
32.article_body: The body of an 18-year-old nurse was found hanging by a rope from the outer wall of a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district on Saturday. The woman's family alleged that she was gangraped and murdered and lodged an FIR naming four people including the owner of hospital, police said. Notably, the deceased had joined the hospital a day before.

33.title: Odisha announces 6-9 am teaching timings in schools amid record heat
33.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, Odisha has rescheduled the timings of teaching hours in schools. "Government after careful consideration, has been pleased to reschedule the timing of teaching hours in all schools from 6.00 am to 9.00 am wef 2nd May, 2022. However, the examination already scheduled by different Boards/Councils will continue as usual," the government notification read.

34.title: People asked us to do a lip filler, get a nose job: Singers Prakriti & Sukriti
34.article_body: Twin singers Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar said people asked them to do a lip filler and get a nose job done. "We both have typical Punjabi noses, so a lot of people used to be like maybe you should try it," the twins said. "For me, body positivity...means feeling good in your skin no matter...what shape you're in," Prakriti added.

35.title: He always carried cash in Gucci bag for no particular reason: Deb remembers Taz
35.article_body: Singer-songwriter Deb remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Saturday at the age of 54. "He was always carrying loads of cash in his Gucci sling bag for no particular reason. 'You never know; I might need it!'," Deb said, adding, "He was fighting his own battles."

36.title: It was wet all over the place, so I felt we were 10-15 runs short: Ashwin
36.article_body: After their five-wicket defeat against MI, RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said their 158-run total was 10-15 runs short as there was "heavy dew" during the second innings. "It was wet all over the place...and it makes a massive difference, good deliveries tend to get over-pitched," he added. Ashwin picked one wicket, conceding 21 runs in his four overs.

37.title: 4.5kg of Ephedrine drug worth ₹90 lakh seized at Bengaluru airport
37.article_body: A consignment of the Ephedrine drug, weighing over 4.49kg, was seized from the International Courier Terminal at the Bengaluru airport by various agencies. The drug consignment, which amounted to over ₹89.92 lakh, was hidden inside a parcel along with readymade garments and was ready to get despatched to Australia, a Customs official said. Notably, the exporter is a Vijayawada resident.

38.title: Made an original song, just used an old line: Kanika on being accused of stealing Pak song
38.article_body: After Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani accused Kanika Kapoor of copying her song 'Boohey Barian', Kanika said, "We made an original song." She added, "It's not a cover version, it's a new song completely." Kanika further said they just used a "hook line" from an old Punjabi folk song. She stated that they had no intention of stealing anybody's work.

39.title: Jos Buttler records most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player
39.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has recorded the most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player. With his 52-ball 67-run knock against MI, Buttler took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 566 in just nine matches. Buttler overtook Ajinkya Rahane, who had held the previous record with 560 runs for RR in IPL 2012.

40.title: 32-yr-old man dies as Haryana Roadways bus hits bike in Gurugram
40.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Tekchand, was killed and his colleague, Lal Mohan, was injured after a Haryana Roadways bus allegedly hit the motorcycle they were travelling on. Police said that the victims were rushed to the hospital where Tekchand was declared dead on arrival. Police said that FIR has been registered in the case.

41.title: Germany moves ICJ to deny Italy reparations for Nazi atrocities
41.article_body: Germany has registered a case in the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to stop Italy from claiming reparations over Nazi atrocities during World War II. This comes ahead of an Italian court ruling on whether to auction German-owned buildings. On several occasions in the past, Italian courts have directed Germany to pay for damages due to the Nazi atrocities.

42.title: 2nd bombing in 2 days in Afghanistan's Kabul ahead of Eid; 1 dead
42.article_body: One woman was killed and three others were injured after a bomb blast in a passenger van in Afghanistan's Kabul on Saturday, in the second incident in two days ahead of Eid al-Fitr, an official told Reuters. Earlier, over 50 worshippers were killed in a bomb blast at a mosque there. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, Reuters reported.

43.title: Viral pic of crying young woman is fake, Zelenskyy's daughter didn't escape to Poland
43.article_body: A viral photo claiming to show the 17-year-old daughter of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has "fled to Poland" is false, reported Deutsche Welle. Social media sites are falsely spreading an image of a young crying woman, claiming in various languages that Zelenskyy's daughter, Oleksandra Zelenska "hates her father" and had called him a "Nazi" and "murderer of the Ukrainian people."

44.title: Different venues are playing differently, it was tough to bowl vs MI: Samson
44.article_body: After they failed to defend their 158-run total against MI, RR captain Sanju Samson said it was tough to bowl during the second innings at the DY Patil Stadium. "We could've scored a few more runs. [Then] dew came in and it was tough to bowl...Different venues are playing in different ways. Batting first was tough...it was two-paced," he stated.

45.title: Pujara slams another double hundred in county cricket, scores 531 runs in 5 innings
45.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara smashed another double hundred for Sussex in a County Championship Division Two 2022 match against Durham. Pujara scored 203 runs off 334 deliveries in the first innings of the match. Pujara has now scored 531 runs in last five innings for Sussex. The 34-year-old batter has now smashed 15 double hundreds in first-class cricket.

46.title: 2 Bihar men caught with 150 kg marijuana in Nepal
46.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested for allegedly carrying 150 kg marijuana in Nepal's Bara district. The police said they seized the marijuana consignment consisting of 10 packets weighing 15 kg each, according to a report. The two - Ajit Paswan (35) and Ram Darshan Mahato (60) - were sent to judicial custody for further investigation by a court.

47.title: I've been working since I was 5; had no friends, childhood playful stuff: Neetu
47.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor said that she has been working since she was five years old. "So there were no friends. No childhood playful stuff at all. Then I started working with my husband [late actor Rishi Kapoor]," she said, adding that her career started with the actor and that they did 80 movies in seven years.

48.title: TN's Sri Lanka aid resolution shouldn't be for political mileage: BJP
48.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit wrote to state CM MK Stalin on Sunday saying that it welcomes the state assembly's resolution to seek permission from the Centre to provide humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka. However, it claimed that recently, the state government's actions were aimed at getting "political mileage" and it's "only afraid" this resolution shouldn't be for the same reason.

49.title: Chhattisgarh man hung upside down from tree and thrashed; 5 arrested
49.article_body: Five people were arrested after they allegedly hung a man upside down from a tree and thrashed him in Chhattisgarh. Police said accused Manish Khare, Shivraj Khare and Janu Bhargav were taken into custody on Friday while Bhim Kesarwani and 15-year-old boy were detained on Saturday. Police added Manish spotted victim trying to get into his house on April 26.

50.title: Ex-MLA PC George held for making controversial remarks against Muslims
50.article_body: Former MLA and senior Kerala politician, PC George, was taken into police custody for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims. The six-time MLA was booked under Section 153A of the IPC for allegedly making the remarks at an event organised by the Ananthapuri Hindu Maha Sammelan. The 70-year-old politician had alleged that tea sold in Muslim-run restaurants cause "impotence".

51.title: Imran Khan, 150 others booked over slogans against Pak PM in Saudi
51.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and 150 others were booked on Saturday after slogans of "chor-chor" (thief) and "gaddar" (traitor) were raised against the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif and his delegation on their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Saudi Arabia's Medina, officials said. A video of people sloganeering had surfaced online. The booked people include Khan's former cabinet members.

52.title: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder hiked by ₹102.50, will cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi
52.article_body: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50 on Sunday, reported ANI. The 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi, which was earlier priced at ₹2,253. In Mumbai, the commercial LPG price was hiked to ₹2,307 from ₹2,205 per cylinder. In Kolkata and Chennai, a 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,455 and ₹2,508 respectively.

53.title: Kohli's 58(53) was a huge step in the right direction: Du Plessis
53.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has said Virat Kohli's 58-run innings against GT was a huge step in the "right direction". He added, "Cricket is a massive game of confidence and it'll be huge. To get a solid fifty, it's big for him and for us, something that we can take forward." It was Kohli's first fifty of IPL 2022.

54.title: Getting anxiety attacks almost every day, feels like impending doom: Aamir's daughter
54.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan took to Instagram to share that she is getting anxiety attacks almost every day. Adding that it feels like "impending doom", she wrote, "It feels pretty helpless. Because I really want to go to sleep (it usually happens at night for me) but I can't because it won't stop."

55.title: Economy is in shambles, but BJP more concerned about UCC: Owaisi
55.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP on domestic economic issues. "The country's economy is in shambles, passenger trains are being cancelled to transport coal, unemployment is rising but you're more concerned about the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)," Owaisi said. "Why is the Hindu Undivided Family tax rebate not there for Muslims and Christians?" the 52-year-old politician asked.

56.title: Had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre: Rakeysh on Delhi-6 song
56.article_body: Filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra said that when they were shooting for the song 'Dil Gira Dafatan' in the movie 'Delhi-6', they did not have the same tools like today. He said they had to improvise a lot. "We had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre, with the help of Google Earth images," he added.

57.title: Govt plans to declare Delhi’s 1000-yr-old lake a national monument
57.article_body: Union Minister of State for Culture Arjun Ram Meghwal said that the government is planning to declare Delhi's Anang Tal lake, which is said to be about a thousand years old, as a national monument. During a visit to the site in South Delhi, Meghwal asked the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to expedite the restoration work of the lake.

58.title: No Muslim woman wants husband to get 3 other wives: Assam CM on UCC
58.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) isn't his issue but an "issue for all Muslim women". "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives," he added. To provide justice to Muslim women, triple talaq has to be removed and UCC needs to be brought in, he further said.

59.title: Mouni Roy recommends Astrotalk for marriage predictions
59.article_body: Mouni Roy recently collaborated with Astrotalk and praised the astrology app for serving 3 crore+ customers. She recommended people to chat with astrologers at Astrotalk to get accurate love, marriage, and career-related predictions. Astrotalk offers first chat with astrologers for free for people to try the app.

60.title: I refused a lot of male-centric, Khan or Kumar-led films: Kangana Ranaut
60.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she refused a lot of male-centric films. "[I refused many] Khan-led films or Kumar-led films [and] all kinds of big hero films," she added. When asked if she feels there is pay parity for female actors in the film industry, Kangana said, "I can say that I am not underpaid."

61.title: Big achievement: Chhavi as she visits salon at hospital after breast cancer surgery
61.article_body: Chhavi Mittal, who underwent surgery for breast cancer earlier this week, recently paid a visit to a salon at her hospital. Sharing a video of her salon visit on Saturday, she wrote, "Felt so proud of myself to walk to...salon...and sit there to get my hair washed...Big achievement." Chhavi added she also "took the most painful...but most refreshing shower today".

62.title: Anupam attends 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai's son's wedding, shares pics
62.article_body: Anupam Kher recalled being college roommates with 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai as he attended the wedding of the latter's son Nachiket. Sharing some pictures from Nachiket's wedding, Anupam wrote on Instagram that he and Anang shared a room in Delhi for three years when they attended National School of Drama. "To attend his and Chitra's son's...wedding...was pure joy," he added.

63.title: India reports 3,324 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases reach 19,092
63.article_body: India has reported 3,324 COVID-19 cases, 2,876 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 50 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,092, while the death toll rose to 5,23,843.

64.title: Madras High Court declares Mother Nature as a 'Living Being'
64.article_body: Madras High Court has used the "parens patriae jurisdiction" to declare Mother Nature as a 'Living Being', with all the rights, duties and liabilities of a living person, to help conserve and preserve it. Indiscriminate destruction of nature will cause several complications in ecosystem, the court observed. The court also directed the state and central government to protect Mother Nature.

65.title: Ashwin's wife consoles Rohit's wife after spinner dismisses MI captain, video goes viral
65.article_body: RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's wife Prithi consoled MI captain Rohit Sharma's wife Ritika after Ashwin dismissed Rohit in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. Rohit was dismissed by the spinner for two runs off five deliveries in the third over of MI's innings. MI, however, went on to win the match by five wickets.

66.title: Lord Ram had bow, Yogi Adityanath has bulldozer: Sakshi Maharaj
66.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Sakshi Maharaj said, "While Lord Ram and Krishna had 'dhanush' (bow) and 'sudarshan chakra' respectively, our baba (Yogi Adityanath) has a bulldozer, which is being used against land mafia." Meanwhile, talking about leaders of opposition parties visiting Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan in Sitapur jail, he said, "I'm keeping an eye on it...and government...is aware of it."

67.title: Directors I worked with wanted short & sexy clothes for heroines: Manish Malhotra
67.article_body: Speaking about his journey in Bollywood, designer Manish Malhotra said he "really came into the limelight" after working with director Ram Gopal Varma on 'Rangeela'. Manish revealed that such types of clothes became a trend after he designed Urmila Matondkar's clothes in 'Rangeela'. He added the directors he was working with wanted clothes that were glamorous, sexy and short.

68.title: Scrap godown in Hyderabad catches fire, no casualties reported
68.article_body: A godown of scrap goods in Hyderabad's Musheerabad area caught fire on Saturday. Three fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the incident was reported by the locals at around 8 pm. According to the officials, no casualties have been reported yet and it is suspected that a short circuit could be the cause of the fire accident.

69.title: K'taka institute announces free education for kids of Kashmiri Pandits
69.article_body: Convener of Ambika Mahavidyalaya in Karnataka has announced free education for children of Kashmiri Pandits. "It will cost up to Rs 80,000 per student for a year to get education in this institute. The other facilities would cost them Rs 50,000 annually. But all facilities would be freely available to the children of Kashmiri Pandits," he added.

70.title: Burden is off Jadeja's shoulders: Ajay Jadeja on Dhoni returning as CSK captain
70.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja will be relieved after handing over the CSK captaincy back to MS Dhoni. He added, "If Dhoni is in the team, he must be the captain. Everyone is happy...the burden is off [Jadeja's] shoulders now." CSK lost six of their first eight matches in IPL 2022 under Ravindra Jadeja.

71.title: There was romance in films, husband was not comfortable with it: Bhagyashree
71.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that her husband Himalay Dassani was not comfortable with her getting involved in films because they had romance in it. "The kind of films that were being made and having a very possessive husband, it gave a lesser spectrum of films that I could have worked on without him," she added.

72.title: Pune won't face water cuts as monsoon expected on time: PMC
72.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation said that the city won't face any water supply cuts as there is sufficient stock in four dams and monsoon is expected to arrive on time. The water stock in four dams - Panshet, Warasgaon, Khadakwasla and Temghar - was at 36% capacity on Saturday. The stock is adequate for the next one month, said an official.

73.title: Man poses as govt officer, cheats woman of ₹89 lakh in Bengaluru
73.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Bengaluru after he allegedly cheated a woman of ₹89 lakh by posing as an Intelligence Bureau officer. The man had told the woman that her passport was on a blacklist and that she'd been booked for "suspected terrorist activities act", according to police. The accused had reportedly promised to help her clear her name.

74.title: Man confronts girlfriend over affair, his friend gets killed in Pune
74.article_body: A 21-year-old man, Ganesh Ravindra Gaikwad, was stabbed to death after he accompanied his friend, Rahul Valanj, who wanted to confront his alleged girlfriend over suspicion of an affair in Pune. The girl called her uncle when Valanj confronted her at the shop where she worked. The uncle came with a few men and stabbed Gaikwad during a violent fight.

75.title: Our real potential came out against RR: Rohit on 1st win of IPL 2022
75.article_body: After MI defeated RR by five wickets to register their first win of the ongoing IPL season, captain Rohit Sharma said their "real potential" came out in the match. He added, "We were [also] not blown away by the opposition [in the previous games], we came really close. Had we won those games, things would have been slightly different."

76.title: Old Ramzan parking sign goes viral, Hyd police asks to not believe it
76.article_body: IPS AV Ranganath took to Twitter to share a notice from the Hyderabad Traffic Police, requesting the public to not believe an old Ramzan parking signage. "2014 parking signage related post [is] being viral every year during Ramzan season, circulating on Social Media 'Ramzan Mubarak-Vehicle Parking For Musallis'...request all citizens not to believe such postings and not circulate," post read.

77.title: Man pours petrol on lit pyre, causes explosion in Pune; 11 injured
77.article_body: As many as 11 people were injured after a man allegedly poured petrol over a lit pyre, causing an explosion, during a funeral at a crematorium in Pune on Saturday. The man wanted to "fasten the burning process", according to a police official. At least 80 people were present at the crematorium for the funeral, the deceased's family member said.

78.title: Electric scooter catches fire in Tamil Nadu, owner escapes by jumping off burning vehicle
78.article_body: An electric scooter caught fire in Hosur, an industrial hub in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district, on Saturday causing panic in the area, PTI reported. The owner, Satish Kumar, a supervisor at a Bengaluru firm, escaped after he jumped down from the burning scooter. Kumar had bought the vehicle last year. Recently, multiple reports of electric scooters catching fire have surfaced.

79.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Saturday released
79.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 44°C or more as their maximum temperature on Saturday. Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded the highest maximum temperature at 46.6°C, followed by Bramhapuri (46.3°C). Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Jharkhand's Daltonganj recorded maximum temperature of 46°C each. Jaisalmer recorded maximum temperature of 45.9°C.

80.title: Ate only chana for a week to wear clothes designed by Manish Malhotra: Twinkle
80.article_body: Recalling an incident from the movie 'Baadshah', actress Twinkle Khanna said that she ate only chana for a week. "This is what you had to do to wear your clothes," she said in an interview with designer Manish Malhotra. Malhotra said that young directors wanted the clothes to be "glamorous and sexy".

81.title: Hero Electric dispatched zero vehicles in April amid chip shortage
81.article_body: Hero Electric, India's largest electric two-wheeler manufacturer by volume, has reported zero dispatches in April 2022 due to the global chip shortage. "It's like putting an emergency brake on a fast-moving train. Our sales were almost doubling month on month and we somehow managed...but the (Russia-Ukraine) war collapsed a major supply chain, resulting in this disruption," CEO Sohinder Gill said.

82.title: MI beat RR in last over to register their 1st win in IPL 2022 after 8 losses in a row
82.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) by five wickets in the last over on Saturday to register theri first victory in IPL 2022 after eight consecutive losses. With the win, MI ended RR's three-match winning streak. Suryakumar Yadav top-scored for MI with 51(39), while MI's Hrithik Shokeen and Riley Meredith took two wickets each in the match.

83.title: Will loudspeaker demand solve unemployment issue?: Sharad Pawar
83.article_body: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made "to take the country backwards in the name of caste and religion". Hinting at Raj Thackeray's demand to remove loudspeakers from mosques, Sharad Pawar questioned if this would solve unemployment. Pawar's comment comes ahead of the MNS chief's visit to Aurangabad, where he will address the issue.

84.title: Law & order deteriorating in Punjab: Anurag Thakur on Patiala clash
84.article_body: Condemning the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over the clashes that broke out in Patiala, Punjab, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that it reflects the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. "Even before polls, questions were raised about the intentions and capabilities of AAP," Thakur said. He questioned if AAP would take action against those trying to disrupt peace.

85.title: Andhra Education Minister must resign: TDP on class 10 exam paper leak
85.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP), which is the main Opposition party in Andhra Pradesh, demanded the resignation of the state's Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana over the class 10 exam paper leak case. The TDP also questioned why the CM was 'silent' over the issue. "They [YSRCP] were playing dangerous games with the lives of lakhs of students," a TDP leader said.

86.title: Will prove majority in Parliament next week: Sri Lankan Opp'n
86.article_body: A leader of the Sri Lankan Opposition said that his party, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), will prove its majority in Parliament next week during a no-confidence motion. "President should resign...and...constitutional reforms should follow to ensure checks and balances among...pillars of the government," Lakshman Kiriella added. The political instability began amid an economic crisis in the country.

87.title: Massive fire breaks out in forest of J&K's Rajouri amid heatwave
87.article_body: As Jammu and Kashmir continues to reel under a heatwave, a massive fire broke out in different forest areas of Rajouri on Saturday. Images showed clouds of smoke billowing from the forest area. This fire was reported a few days after a fire broke out in the forest area in the Reasi district, destroying trees and other forest materials.

88.title: ₹105-cr greenfield grain-based ethanol plant inaugurated in Bihar
88.article_body: A ₹105-crore greenfield grain-based ethanol plant was inaugurated by Bihar CM Nitish Kumar in Purnea on Saturday. It's India's first such plant and was developed under Bihar Ethanol Production Promotion Policy 2021, according to a tweet by the CM's official account. Speaking on the occasion, the CM said that ethanol production will help reduce petrol costs and generate employment.

89.title: PM Shehbaz Sharif's son takes oath as CM of Pakistan's Punjab
89.article_body: Hamza Shehbaz, son of Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday took the oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab. The oath of office was administered to him by National Assembly Speaker Raja Pervaiz Ashraf at the Governor House in Lahore. Notably, PM Shehbaz had served as Punjab CM three times, with his third term lasting from 2013 to 2018.

90.title: Amber Heard called it a practical joke gone wrong: Depp's guard on defecation in bed
90.article_body: Johnny Depp's security guard Starling Jenkins said Amber Heard called faeces found in the couple's bed a "horrible practical joke gone wrong", a court heard. He described how he had driven Heard to Coachella and had a conversation pertaining to "the surprise she had left in the boss' bed". Asked what he was referring to, he replied, "The defecation."

91.title: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara & husband accused of having sex with 13-yr-old girl
91.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara Phythian and her husband Victor Marke have been accused of sexually abusing a minor and 'threatening to smash her kneecaps if she told anyone'. The survivor, now a woman, told the court she was abused from ages 13 to 15. She alleged that Phythian told her to have oral sex with Marke.

92.title: RR's Ashwin has been a mystery bowler in IPL 2022: Dasgupta
92.article_body: Calling Ravichandran Ashwin a "mystery bowler" in IPL 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said the RR off-spinner is using different variations and has been a revelation to a great extent. "Until now, he has not bowled his traditional off-spinners on very less occasions and has instead used a carrom ball and flippers," he added.

93.title: Parked private school bus catches fire in Jammu, no one injured
93.article_body: A bus belonging to a private school in Jammu caught fire while it was parked inside the school premises on Saturday. "We noticed smoke in the bus which might be due to a technical fault or heat. The fire was controlled in half an hour," school officials said. The buses parked near it were removed and no injuries were reported.

94.title: Pak aims to double hydroelectric output in 7 yrs amid power shortage
94.article_body: Pakistan aims to double its hydroelectric output in the next seven years to meet the rising power demand in the country, a state media report said. The country is reeling under a worsening energy crisis, resulting in up to 10-18 hours of load-shedding in parts of the country. Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif blamed the previous government for the current situation.

95.title: Pics show wreckage left behind on Mars by NASA rover
95.article_body: NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter snapped pictures showing the parachute that helped the agency's Perseverance rover land on Mars and the cone-shaped backshell that protected the rover in deep space and during its descent. "Many of...the 80 high-strength suspension lines connecting the backshell to the parachute are visible and appear intact," wrote NASA. The rover landed on Mars in February 2021.

96.title: IDFC FIRST Bank's Q4 profit rises 168% year-on-year to ₹343 crore
96.article_body: IDFC FIRST Bank reported that its net profit for the quarter ended March 2022 surged 168% to ₹343 crore as compared to ₹128 crore in the year-ago period. This was driven by strong growth in core operating income and lower provisioning, the bank said. IDFC's profit for financial year 2021-22 stood at ₹145 crore, marking a year-on-year decline of 68%.

97.title: He's gone, done it again: Swann on Tewatia's 25-ball 43* vs RCB
97.article_body: Praising GT batter Rahul Tewatia for his 25-ball 43* in the side's six-wicket win against RCB in IPL 2022, Graeme Swann took to Twitter and wrote, "He's gone and done it again!! Tewatia amazing stuff." Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Tewatia keeps punishing those length deliveries. Plays to his strength and keeps delivering for GT." He was adjudged "Player of the Match".

98.title: Beijing bans dine-in services during holidays in May to curb outbreak
98.article_body: Authorities in China's capital Beijing have banned dine-in services during the Labour Day holidays in May to curb the spread of COVID-19. The decision comes after the city began mass testing millions of residents earlier this week amid a coronavirus outbreak. The restaurants have been ordered to only provide takeout services from Sunday to Wednesday.

99.title: Longewala border post in Raj to be turned into tourist attraction
99.article_body: The Rajasthan government and Border Security Force (BSF) are working to develop the Longewala border post in Jaisalmer into a tourist attraction along with Tanot Mata Temple and Kishangarh Fort. Tourists will be allowed to visit the Bavaliyawala border and watch the retreat ceremony. Meanwhile, BSF documentaries, weapons and a photo gallery will be displayed at the Tanot base.

100.title: Football superagent Mino Raiola, who represented Pogba & Ibrahimovic, passes away aged 54
100.article_body: Football superagent Mino Raiola passed away aged 54 on Saturday after battling a serious illness since January. Raiola represented footballers including Paul Pogba, Erling Haaland, Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Gianluigi Donnarumma, Matthijs de Ligt and Mario Balotelli. "Mino fought until the end with the same strength he put on negotiation tables to defend our players," Raiola's family said in a statement.

101.title: There's peace as of now: Punjab CM after Patiala clashes
101.article_body: A day after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala over an anti-Khalistan march, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said, "There's peace in [the city] as of now". "Shiv Sena, Congress and Shiromani Akali Dal...workers clashed with each other," he said. Police officials have been transferred and peace committee meetings are being conducted, he added.

102.title: Is Nehru ji to blame for PM Modi's failure?: Rahul on power crisis
102.article_body: Criticising PM Narendra Modi over the ongoing power crisis in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday asked if he would be blaming "Nehru ji or states or people" for his "failure". He also shared a video of an earlier speech by the PM in which he promised 24-hour electricity, writing, "PM's promises and intentions have always been disconnected."

103.title: Real Madrid win record-extending 35th La Liga title
103.article_body: Real Madrid on Saturday clinched a record-extending 35th La Liga title after defeating Espanyol 4-0. Rodrygo scored twice, while Marco Asensio and Karim Benzema added a goal each to give Real Madrid their second league title in three seasons, and third in six years. Real Madrid won the title with four league matches remaining in the season.

104.title: I'm happy but never satisfied: PBKS' Arshdeep on his form in IPL 2022
104.article_body: Talking about his performance in ongoing IPL, PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh said he's happy but never satisfied. "My plan has always been to bowl in good areas and let the batter make mistakes...in death overs I just try to keep things simple," he added. Arshdeep has so far taken three wickets from nine matches at an economy rate of 7.70.

105.title: DSP injured in gunfight with drug traffickers in Assam, 2 arrested
105.article_body: Assam Police said that Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Headquarters, Anurag Sarmah was injured during a gunfight with alleged drug traffickers in Goalpara, Assam. Police said that two drug traffickers were arrested and drugs were seized from them. During a routine check, the police team directed the two bikers to stop, but they tried to flee, the police added.

106.title: Poll announcement soon?: Kejriwal on reports of Guj BJP leaders meeting PM
106.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday took to Twitter and asked if the BJP is going to announce fresh elections in Gujarat after dissolving the Gujarat assembly next week. Kejriwal's statement comes as PM Narendra Modi reportedly held a meeting with Gujarat BJP leaders in Delhi on Saturday. "Are they so scared of AAP?" Kejriwal added.

107.title: BJP mismanaging power crisis like COVID-19: Congress' Kamal Nath
107.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath condemned the BJP in Madhya Pradesh and at the Centre over the power crisis and accused the party of taking the issue lightly, saying the crisis was being 'mismanaged like COVID-19'. "This is the consequence of the corruption they (BJP) have done in the last two years," he said. BJP is denying the crisis, he added.

108.title: Serbia showcases its Chinese missile system amid concerns in West
108.article_body: Serbia on Saturday publicly displayed the new surface-to-air missile system it purchased from China, amid concerns among its neighbours and the West over peace in the region. Serbia is currently the only European country to operate the FK-3 system. The Chinese system is similar to the American Patriot and the Russian S-300 surface-to-air missile systems, according to several reports.

109.title: Turkey, Saudi Arabia to revive great economic potential: Turkish Prez
109.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Saturday said that Turkey and Saudi Arabia have a common will to reactivate a great economic potential between them. Erdoğan made the comment after his first trip to the Gulf kingdom since 2017. Saudi funding could help Turkey alleviate its economic woes ahead of the presidential election next year, according to analysts and officials.

110.title: Same Xiaomi allowed to donate ₹10 cr to PM-CARES Fund: Moitra on ED seizure
110.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Saturday reacted to the Enforcement Directorate's seizure of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore over Forex law violations. Moitra said the same Xiaomi was earlier "allowed to donate ₹10 crore to opaque PM-CARES Fund". Notably, Congress had earlier questioned why PM Modi's COVID-19 fund was accepting donations from Chinese companies.

111.title: Man poses as CM & tries to cheat MLA in Raj to fund girlfriend's hobbies, arrested
111.article_body: A 28-year-old computer engineer was arrested from Andhra Pradesh after he tried to cheat an MLA in Rajasthan of ₹30,000 by posing as CM Ashok Gehlot, police said. The man, who had earlier cheated two ministers and 3 MLAs in Andhra Pradesh of ₹1.80 crore in 2019, used the loot to fund his girlfriend's expensive hobbies, police added.

112.title: Dhoni leading CSK again might seem like deja vu, but it's Jadeja vu: Jaffer
112.article_body: After MS Dhoni was reappointed as CSK skipper, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "The feeling we're all going to experience seeing Dhoni lead CSK again might seem like deja vu, but it's in fact [Ravindra] Jadeja vu." Jadeja decided to relinquish the captaincy on Saturday. He led defending champions CSK in eight matches in IPL 2022, winning only two of them.

113.title: Temperature crosses 45°C-mark at 9 places in Rajasthan; IMD issues alert
113.article_body: The maximum temperature at nine places in Rajasthan crossed the 45°C-mark on Saturday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for heatwave in Jhunjhunu, Alwar, Bharatpur, Dholpur, Dungarpur and Banswara till May 3. The department has also issued an orange alert for Bikaner, Barmer, Churu, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur and Sri Ganganagar for the same duration.

114.title: Shaw shares 'amazing sentence in English' post for Tharoor; MP corrects spelling
114.article_body: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted a post titled 'an amazing sentence in English' and wrote, "Something for Shashi Tharoor's amusement!" It claimed that the person who wrote the sentence, which is a rhopalic sentence, must be a vocabulary genius. Responding to Shaw, Congress MP wrote, "Alas, Kiran, "incomprehensibleness" is not a word. It's "incomprehensibility", and that's only 19 letters."

115.title: Russian state TV shows how nuclear strike can hit London, Paris in 200 seconds
115.article_body: A Russian state TV simulated nuclear strikes on Europe, claiming the nuclear bombs would hit Paris, Berlin and London in around 200 seconds. The hosts claimed that there would be "no survivors" in the strikes. This comes as the Russian invasion of Ukraine continues after beginning in late February.

116.title: 9 'illegal' shops owned by Congress leader bulldozed in MP
116.article_body: Nine shops owned by Congress leader Pankaj Ahirwar in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh were demolished using bulldozers on Saturday as part of the BJP-led government's drive against encroachment. According to the administration, the shops in front of the Collectorate were constructed illegally on government land. The SDM, Tehsildar and administrative staff were in attendance during the demolition.

117.title: Zerodha's profits grew over 50% in 2021-22, thanks to bull run: CEO
117.article_body: Stockbroking firm Zerodha recorded more than 50% jump in revenue and profitability for 2021-22, its CEO Nithin Kamath said. Thanking the liquidity-driven bull run in markets, Kamath explained that a shift to work from home, increased savings, bull market, volatility, IPOs, and India stack led to significant growth in the unicorn startup's investor base in the last two years.

118.title: Action must be taken if loudspeaker is used to provoke: Kamal Nath
118.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath, spoke on the issue of loudspeakers on Saturday, saying that it is a "private matter" and "should not be made a public issue because peoples' sentiments are attached to it". He however stated that the loudspeakers shouldn't be misused and that action must be taken "if loudspeakers are used with the intention of provoking".

119.title: Great Indian Reader: Tharoor on fan's pic of collection of books written by him
119.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to a picture of a huge stack of books authored by him that was shared by a fan of his. "Added all the new ones to my Shashi Tharoor corner," the fan wrote while sharing the picture. "Wow! Now there's a Great Indian Reader!" Tharoor responded.

120.title: Pant has great cricketing mind, he'll captain Team India soon: WV Raman
120.article_body: Ex-India Women's coach WV Raman said DC skipper Rishabh Pant has the potential to captain Team India in future. "For now, he has to learn the ropes in the next one and two years as far as captaincy is concerned," he added. "Pant has a great cricketing mind, but he is on a learning curve," he further said.

121.title: BCom student in MP dies by suicide after appearing for exam
121.article_body: A 22-year-old BCom student in MP allegedly died by suicide on Saturday after appearing for an exam. The victim returned home around 3 pm and later locked herself in another room where she was found dead, police said, adding a suicide note wasn't found. Her sisters believe she took the step due to exam pressure.

122.title: Angelina Jolie spotted at a cafe in Ukraine amid war; video surfaces
122.article_body: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie was spotted at a cafe in Ukraine's Lviv on Saturday, with several people sharing her video online. Another video showed her talking to people at a train station in the city amid Russia-Ukraine war. While her visit has not been announced officially, a Belarusian advisor claimed she arrived in Ukraine as part of the UNHCR's mission.

123.title: Delhi records 1,520 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate at 5%
123.article_body: Delhi on Saturday recorded 1,520 fresh COVID-19 infections, as compared to 1,607 infections recorded in the national capital on Friday. One person died of the virus in the last 24 hours in Delhi while 1,412 people recovered in the same period. The city's daily positivity rate was at 5.10% on Saturday as compared to 5.28% on Friday.

124.title: Jack Dorsey, Peter Thiel encouraged Musk to take Twitter private: WSJ
124.article_body: A group of "libertarian-leaning activists and businessmen", PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel, and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey encouraged Elon Musk to take Twitter private, the Wall Street Journal reported. Musk and Dorsey believed Twitter could be run more effectively as a private company and they focussed on its role as a potential public good, the WSJ said, quoting former executives.

125.title: Russian forces hit 389 targets in Ukraine overnight: Russia
125.article_body: Russian artillery units had struck 389 Ukrainian targets overnight, Russia said on Saturday. The targets included 35 control points, 15 arms and ammunition depots and several areas where Ukrainian troops and equipment were concentrated. Notably, Ukraine said that Russia had failed to capture three target areas in Ukraine's Donbas region despite several strikes by Russian forces.

126.title: Mohammad Shami's gesture after Virat Kohli's fifty goes viral
126.article_body: GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami's gesture after RCB batter Virat Kohli scored his maiden fifty in IPL 2022 has gone viral. Following the last ball of the over in which Kohli reached his half-century, Shami was seen patting Kohli's back and putting his arm around Kohli's shoulder to appreciate his knock. "What a lovely moment," a fan commented.

127.title: 3 accused arrested, 24 identified after violent clashes in Patiala
127.article_body: Three accused have been arrested a day after violent clashes broke out in Punjab's Patiala, police said. Patiala SSP Deepak Parik said that around 24 other accused have been identified and special teams have been formed to arrest them. He added that curfew, which was imposed following the clashes, has been lifted and internet services have been restored in Patiala.

128.title: K'taka Home Minister should resign: Ex-CM on PSI recruitment scam
128.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra a day after the Karnataka government announced its decision to annul the PSI recruitment exam and conduct a re-examination. "On what moral grounds can (Jnanendra) continue as Home Minister?" he tweeted. He also sought Karnataka CM's clarification over the government's decision to re-conduct the exam.

129.title: Centre's help needed to develop border areas: Arunachal Pradesh Min
129.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Home Minister Bamang Felix on Saturday said, "Infrastructural and economic development of our border areas...requires constant efforts and interventions by the Union government." The topography and sparsely populated regions with limited infrastructure pose a challenge to connectivity, he added. Notably, Arunachal Pradesh shares a land border with China, Bhutan and Myanmar.

130.title: You were silent on WB post-poll violence: Ex-bureaucrats to group that criticised PM
130.article_body: Responding to 108 ex-bureaucrats who questioned PM Narendra Modi's "silence" on recent incidents of communal violence, 197 ex-bureaucrats and judges said the group maintained a "studied silence" over post-poll violence in West Bengal. "It lays bare their cynical, unprincipled approach to issues," said the open letter. Major communal violence incidents have reduced under BJP government, it claimed.

131.title: Hardik looking exactly how Rohit was when he became MI captain: Gavaskar
131.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said the role of captaincy is doing the same thing to GT's Hardik Pandya as it did to Rohit Sharma in 2013 when he was appointed the MI skipper. He added the responsibility transformed Rohit into an improved batter and a leader and Hardik is showing the same qualities. GT are presently placed on top of the standings.

132.title: Ensure coal availability at power plants: Chhattisgarh CM to Centre
132.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that the Centre should ensure the availability of coal at power plants across India amid the power crisis. Baghel's comment came after the Ministry of Power released a statement saying the country was facing a power crisis wherein the peak power demand for electricity touched an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW on Friday.

133.title: Naby Keita scores to send Liverpool top of Premier League in 1-0 win
133.article_body: Naby Keita scored on Saturday to send Liverpool to the top of the Premier League table with a 1-0 win over Newcastle United. Keita scored in the 19th minute. Liverpool now have a two-point lead over Manchester City who play later on Saturday. Liverpool will face Villarreal in the second-leg of their Champions League semi-final on Tuesday.

134.title: Part of under-construction bridge over Ganga collapses in Bihar; CM orders probe
134.article_body: A section of an under-construction four-lane bridge, which was being built at a cost of ₹1,710 crore, over river Ganga linking Sultanganj and Khagaria in Bihar collapsed on Saturday early morning. "The collapse of the superstructure raises questions on the quality of construction," a JD(U) MLA said. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has ordered an inquiry into the matter.

135.title: MP caught watching porn in UK parliament resigns, calls it 'moment of madness'
135.article_body: UK MP Neil Parish has resigned after he was caught watching porn on his phone while sitting alongside a female member in UK parliament. Parish said the first time he looked at porn, it was accidental, but admitted that the second time was deliberate. Calling it a "moment of madness", he said, "I wasn't proud of what I was doing."

136.title: Fuelling politics of hate: Ex-bureaucrats respond to open letter criticising PM
136.article_body: Some 197 former judges and bureaucrats have responded to an open letter by a group of 108 ex-bureaucrats who had criticised PM Narendra Modi's "silence" amid a "frenzy of hate-filled destruction". "Their 'anger' is...empty virtue-signalling...they're fuelling the politics of hate they seek to combat by attempting to engineer hate against the government with...false portrayals," said the group.

137.title: Table-toppers GT win their 5th match in a row, RCB suffer 3rd straight defeat
137.article_body: Table-toppers Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) by six wickets to register their fifth straight victory in IPL 2022. RCB have now lost three matches in a row. GT chased down the 171-run target in the 20th over. It was the fifth time that GT finished a successful run chase in the 20th over in IPL 2022.

138.title: India has 4 crore pending court cases: Chief Justice of India
138.article_body: India has more than 4 crore cases pending in lower courts, Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said on Saturday. "We have 20 judges per 10 lakh people, which is highly inadequate to deal with the rising trend of litigation," the CJI stated. He said this during a conference attended by PM Narendra Modi and Chief Ministers.

139.title: BJP trying to divide Hindus in Maha: Uddhav amid Hanuman Chalisa row
139.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday accused BJP of trying to divide Hindus in the state. Thackeray said, "It is the BJP's conspiracy to divide Hindus and Marathis and non-Marathis in Maharashtra." His remarks came amid the controversy surrounding MP-MLA couple Navneet Rana and Ravi, who were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Thackeray's home.

140.title: 6-storey building housing hotel, flats collapses in China; 23 trapped, 39 missing
140.article_body: At least 39 people are missing and 23 are trapped after a six-storey building collapsed in China's Hunan province, officials said on Saturday. At least five people have been rescued so far, Chinese Media reported. The owner of the property, which housed restaurant, a cafe, a family-run hotel and flats, has been detained over suspicion of illegal construction.

141.title: Our royalty payments, bank statements are legit: Xiaomi as ED seizes ₹5,551 cr
141.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore "in connection with illegal outward remittances", the company said, "As a brand committed to India, all our operations are firmly compliant with local laws and regulations." Xiaomi further said, "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful."

142.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused was in touch with ISIS fighters: UP Police
142.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar on Saturday said that Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, the accused in the Gorakhnath Temple attack case, was in contact with ISIS fighters and sympathisers through social media. Kumar also claimed that the accused had sent around ₹8.5 lakh as well as various arms to many countries to support ISIS terror activities.

143.title: Van de Zandschulp beats world no. 7 Ruud to reach SFs of BMW Open
143.article_body: Botic van de Zandschulp on Friday beat world number seven Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-1 to reach the semi-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "[The] second set was a little bit easier, but I think I played really well today," the 26-year-old said. Van de Zandschulp also beat Ruud, a seven-time ATP Tour winner, at the US Open last year.

144.title: Ravindra Jadeja hands over CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni
144.article_body: Ravindra Jadeja has decided to relinquish captaincy to focus and concentrate more on his game and has requested MS Dhoni to lead CSK, the franchise said. Dhoni has accepted to lead CSK in the larger interest and to allow Jadeja to focus on his game, it added. CSK have lost six of their first eight matches in IPL 2022.

145.title: RCB need a minimum of 3 wins in next 5 league matches: Jaffer
145.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said that RCB would be demoralised after their batting order collapsed in the last two matches in IPL 2022. He added that they need a minimum of three wins in the next five league matches. "They don't want to be in a must-win situation," he further said. RCB are currently on a two-match losing streak.

146.title: Matt Judge resigns as Man Utd director of football negotiations
146.article_body: Matt Judge has resigned as Manchester United's director of football negotiations. Judge has been in charge of transfer and contract negotiations at the club over the past eight years. He is currently serving a notice period before departing later this year. Judge was appointed by Ed Woodward, the club's former executive vice-chairman who left in February of this year.

147.title: MI to bowl first against RR, MI make 2 changes to their playing XI
147.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. MI have included Tim David and Kumar Kartikeya in their playing XI. RR have not made any changes to their playing XI. RR have won three matches in a row in IPL 2022.

148.title: N Korea to launch pre-emptive nuclear strike if threatened, says Kim
148.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has warned that North Korea could launch a pre-emptive nuclear strike if threatened. Kim made the comments as he praised military officials over the staging of parade in Pyongyang on Monday, which marked the 90th anniversary of the army's founding. Notably, North Korea has conducted 13 rounds of weapons launches so far this year.

149.title: Hyderabad man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing daughter
149.article_body: A 33-year-old man from Hyderabad's Kamatipura area was reportedly sentenced to rigorous life imprisonment for killing his six-month-old daughter in 2015. The accused, Md Saleem, was also asked to pay a fine of ₹25,000. According to a complaint by Saleem's wife, he slammed the infant against a sofa during an altercation, after which the baby became unresponsive.

150.title: 15 wagons of goods train carrying coal derails in UP; restoration work underway
150.article_body: Fifteen wagons of a goods train carrying coal, which was on its way to Haryana's Kalanaur, derailed at the new Ekdil railway station of the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor (DFC) near Uttar Pradesh's Etawah on Saturday. The freight train track was blocked following the incident, while the passenger train route was not affected. Work for restoration has reportedly started.

151.title: Will take strict action against disruptors of peace in Punjab: Kejriwal
151.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that strict action will be taken against those who will disrupt the peace of Punjab. His remarks came a day after stones were hurled and swords were brandished when clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala. Notably, the Punjab government has transferred Patiala IG, SSP and SP following the clashes.

152.title: Joe Biden laughs at himself after fumbling on 'kleptocracy', video surfaces
152.article_body: A video has shown US President Joe Biden fumbling over the word 'kleptocracy' during a speech. Biden is heard saying, "We're going to seize [Russian oligarchs'] yachts, luxury homes and other ill-begotten gains of (Russian President Vladimir) Putin's kleptoc- yeah- kleptocracy and klep- the guys who are the kleptocracies." He's heard laughing at himself, saying, "But these are bad guys."

153.title: He's using RR's bowling group brilliantly: Hayden on skipper Samson
153.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden said RR have the best bowling line-up in ongoing IPL, adding their skipper Sanju Samson is rotating the bowlers brilliantly. "Despite coin toss not going in...favour of Samson (on so many occasions), his bowlers are accessing some fantastic areas," he added. RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal is currently the leading wicket-taker with 18 wickets from 8 matches.

154.title: People throw notes in theatre during Sonu Sood's entry scene in Acharya, he shares video
154.article_body: Sonu Sood on Saturday shared a video of fans throwing notes during his entry scene in the film 'Acharya', which stars Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan in the lead roles. "Thank you so much to my lovely fans who I proudly call my family...I don't deserve this kind of love, but your kindness keeps me going to do better," he wrote.

155.title: CL qualification would be ‘important achievement’ for Arsenal: Arteta
155.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said securing Champions League qualification this season would be "an important achievement" for the club. Arsenal are currently in fourth place on the Premier League table with five games to play. Arsenal finished in eighth place last season. Arsenal will face seventh-placed West Ham United next in the Premier League on Sunday.

156.title: 14-year-old boy drowns in private swimming pool in MP's Betul
156.article_body: A 14-year-old boy drowned in a private swimming pool in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district on Friday. Vinay Likhitkar had come to BRC Club's pool to meet some family members, who have club membership, police said. He, however, entered the pool himself and drowned after going into the deeper side. He was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead.

157.title: ₹1,500 per acre bonus for farmers opting for direct seeding of rice: Punjab CM
157.article_body: The Punjab government on Saturday announced ₹1,500 per acre as financial assistance to farmers opting for direct seeding of rice (DSR) technique in the upcoming paddy season. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said farmers can start sowing paddy using this method from May 20. "If we use the DSR technique...we can save groundwater for our future generations," he added.

158.title: Russia stole several hundred thousand tonnes of grain: Ukraine
158.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Agriculture Minister Taras Vysotsky on Saturday said that Russian forces have stolen "several hundred thousand tonnes" of grain in areas of Ukraine they occupy. Vysotsky claimed that most of 1.5 million tonnes of grain stored in occupied territory could also be stolen by Russian forces. Ukraine was one of the world's biggest exporters of grain before the invasion.

159.title: Birthday wishes to only batsman who's given me nightmares: Gambhir to Rohit
159.article_body: Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to wish India captain Rohit Sharma on his 35th birthday on Saturday. "Greetings to the only batsman who has given me nightmares as a captain. Thankfully I don't captain anymore," he wrote. Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Happy birthday brotherman, this is the time to back yourself and hit it out of...park like you always have."

160.title: JD(U) doesn't interfere in religion: Bihar CM on loudspeaker issue
160.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday spoke about the BJP's demand for the removal of loudspeakers from religious places, saying, "Everyone's aware of [JD(U)'s] view, we never do any sort of interference in any religion." BJP leader Janak Ram earlier said that if a law on loudspeakers has come into UP, it'll have its effect in Bihar as well.

161.title: Mother & stepfather force teen into prostitution in MP, arrested
161.article_body: Police in MP's Gwalior have arrested the mother and stepfather of a 13-year-old girl, for allegedly forcing her into prostitution. The pair had pushed the girl into a room and locked her with two people who allegedly went on to rape her regularly and were charged money by the stepfather. The other two accused have also been arrested.

162.title: Time to create National Judicial Infrastructure Authority: CJI
162.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday said that a National Judicial Infrastructure Authority has to be established for the standardisation and improvement of judicial infrastructure. The authority would have representation from all the stakeholders, including the representatives of central and state governments, he added. The CJI also flagged several key problems faced by the judiciary.

163.title: IPL debutants GT remind me of RR of 2008 under Warne: Pietersen
163.article_body: Ex-England skipper Kevin Pietersen said watching IPL debutants GT in ongoing season reminds him of RR, when they won the title under late Shane Warne in 2008. "They are consistently finding ways to win, whether from a good, middling or bad position in games," he added. Having lost only one match this season, GT are currently on top of standings.

164.title: Man City’s Guardiola praises ‘devastating’ playmaker Kevin De Bruyne
164.article_body: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola praised playmaker Kevin De Bruyne as "devastating" and the best in the world in his position. "He can run and break the space for the opponent. It's devastating. He is really, really good," Guardiola said. De Bruyne has registered 15 goals and 12 assists in 40 games for City so far this season.

165.title: List of largest Russian fuel importers after war released; US larger buyer than India
165.article_body: An independent organisation Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air has released a list of largest importers of fossil fuels from Russia since it invaded Ukraine in February. Stating that Russia exported fossil fuels worth €63 billion, the study claims that Germany (€9.1 billion) was the biggest importer. It showed that US imported more fossil fuels than India.

166.title: Khadi becomes 1st Indian FMCG firm to clock over ₹1 lakh crore turnover
166.article_body: Khadi & Village Industries Commission (KVIC) has clocked a record annual turnover of ₹1.15 lakh crore in 2021-22. With this, it has become the first and only FMCG company in the country to have recorded a turnover of ₹1 lakh crore, the government said. KVIC's massive turnover comes despite partial lockdown due to second wave of COVID-19 pandemic, it added.

167.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Ajay Devgn post 'Runway 34' release
167.article_body: Ajay Devgn on Saturday took to his social media handles to share a handwritten letter he received from his 'Runway 34' co-star Amitabh Bachchan. "An absolute honour to be a part of '34' and to be the recipient of a magnificent director's gift. Your work is superior," Big B wrote. Ajay also penned a note thanking Amitabh Bachchan.

168.title: No one from Bollywood called me on bypoll win, they're scared: Shatrughan
168.article_body: During an interview, actor and TMC leader Shatrughan Sinha said that no one from Bollywood called him after he won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls. He said, "I have not received a single congratulatory call from the film industry." "These people are so scared, they didn't even try to call...(they must've thought) What if the telephone is tapped," he added.

169.title: Pics show people across India as they battle heatwave
169.article_body: Parts of India are witnessing an intense heatwave, with temperatures in several cities crossing 40°C. Images show people battling heatwave, with one photo showing boys jumping in a water body and another showing a girl selling water using an umbrella to protect herself while waiting for customers. Delhi recorded its second hottest April in 72 years, IMD said on Friday.

170.title: 2 Pune hospitals shortlisted for final selection in govt's 'LaQshya' programme
170.article_body: Two Pune civic hospitals have been shortlisted for final selection in the Centre's Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative (LaQshya) programme, that aims to reduce maternal and newborn mortality. The hospitals shortlisted are Kamla Nehru Hospital and Chandumama Sonawane Maternity Home. The programme aims to improve the quality of care during delivery and post-partum period.

171.title: Coach booked for abetting 23-year-old Kerala basketball player's suicide
171.article_body: A case of abetment to suicide has been registered against an East Central Railway official, who is also a basketball coach, over the death of Lithara KC, a 23-year-old basketball player from Kerala. Lithara allegedly died by suicide at her flat in Bihar. Earlier, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, seeking a "comprehensive and fair investigation".

172.title: Imran Khan hints enemies paid his 2nd wife; she says 'how much did they pay for marriage'
172.article_body: Without naming his second wife Reham Khan, former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "This is the same [Sharif] mafia which paid a woman to write a book against me ahead of 2018 election." Taking to Twitter, Reham Khan replied, "Please ask him how much did they pay me to marry him? To put up with him for a year?"

173.title: Hyd Traffic Police conduct meeting to sensitise ambulance drivers
173.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police conducted a meeting with ambulance owners and drivers of Gandhi Hospital to sensitise them about traffic rules. "Sri K Rawe Shanker, [ACP traffic North Zone Secunderabad] conducted a meeting with ambulance owners and drivers of Gandhi Hospital, Secunderabad and sensitized them on traffic rules," police tweeted. Police told drivers not to demand excess money from patients.

174.title: Anushka Sharma cheers from stands as Kohli smashes fifty, video goes viral
174.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma cheered from the stands as Virat Kohli smashed his first fifty in IPL 2022. A video has gone viral, showing Anushka cheering loudly and giving Kohli a standing ovation. Kohli smashed a fifty in IPL after 14 matches. Kohi has now hit a total of 43 fifties in IPL.

175.title: Govt to sell 51% stake in Pawan Hans to Star9 Mobility for ₹211 cr
175.article_body: The government has approved the sale of its 51% shareholding in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility Private Ltd for ₹211.14 crore.
