Star9 is a consortium of Big Charter Private Limited, Maharaja Aviation Private Limited and Almas Global Opportunity Fund SPC. The helicopter and aero mobility company has been incurring losses over the last three years, the Finance Ministry said.

176.title: Ukraine national team to play friendly in May ahead of WC playoff
176.article_body: The Ukrainian national football team will play a friendly match on May 11 against German club Borussia Monchengladbach ahead of their World Cup playoff semi-final against Scotland on June 1. Ukraine last played in a 2-0 victory over Bosnia and Herzegovina in November. "All Ukrainian citizens will have free entry to the game," said Gladbach Chief Executive Stephan Schippers.

177.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹6.8 lakh on pretext of getting kidney transplant
177.article_body: A Gurugram-based 40-year-old man battling kidney failure was allegedly cheated of ₹6.8 lakh on the pretext of getting a transplant, police said. The victim, Raj Shourey, said, "[The suspect] got me in touch with...owner of a private hospital in Tamil Nadu, who assured me...they would...arrange kidneys for me." Shourey paid ₹6.8 lakh for the treatment, however, it didn't take place.

178.title: Congrats PM Modi for Varanasi's magical transformation: NBA's Howard on India visit
178.article_body: NBA legend Dwight Howard recently visited Varanasi and also shared pictures and videos from the visit on social media. "At peace with myself and the world...A spiritual journey that has rejuvenated the soul," said Howard. He added, "Congratulations (PM) Narendra Modi for the magical reformation of the holy city. Varanasi has inspired so many legends, I am humbled."

179.title: Teenage Maha boy gets shoved while dancing at wedding, stabs man to death
179.article_body: A teenage boy allegedly stabbed a 27-year-old man to death at a wedding in Maharashtra's Nagpur, police said. According to an officer, the incident took place when the two were dancing close to one another and the victim shoved the boy aside. The accused has been booked for murder and further investigation in the matter is underway.

180.title: Now, I'm feeling better: Shahdara rape victim after key accused held
180.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested Mukesh alias Mungeri, the last remaining and one of the prime accused in the Shahdara gang-rape case. After his arrest, the victim said, "Now, I'm feeling better," adding that it was Mukesh that she feared the most. Over 20 people were arrested after the 20-year-old victim was gang-raped and paraded with a blackened face in Shahdara.

181.title: It felt like Kuldeep was trying to buy wickets in IPL 2021: Vettori
181.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said it felt like DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "trying to buy wickets" while representing KKR in IPL 2021. "That may be [because]...Sunil Narine was a certainty and Varun Chakaravarthy was coming into the team," added Vettori. "Kuldeep thought 'If I don't do something I [will]...be out of the team straightaway'," stated Vettori.

182.title: Class 12 student dies by suicide after failing in MP board's English exam
182.article_body: A 17-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after failing the English paper in Class 12 board exams at Gudrughat village of Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat, police said. The deceased was reportedly feeling dejected after failing the exam. She was speaking to her cousin over the phone when she took the extreme step. The state's board exam results were declared on Friday.

183.title: Over 3,000 people lost at sea trying to cross to Europe in 2021: UN
183.article_body: A report by the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said 3,077 refugees, migrants and asylum seekers died or went missing at sea in 2021 trying to cross into Europe using Mediterranean and Atlantic sea routes. "We are seeing the increases soar," UNHCR's Shabia Mantoo said. "It's alarming," she added. The 2021 toll is nearly double the figure from 2020.

184.title: Not at all: Nawaz on if he was afraid to work with Kangana in 'Tiku...'
184.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, who'll star in Kangana Ranaut's first production venture 'Tiku Weds Sheru', spoke about working with Kangana and said, "I enjoyed it a lot." When asked about the perception that Kangana is difficult to work with, he said, "Producers...like her are...rare." Asked if he was afraid to work with Kangana because of this perception, he said, "Not at all."

185.title: 'Spider-Man' director Jon Watts exits Marvel's 'Fantastic Four' reboot
185.article_body: Filmmaker Jon Watts has stepped down from directing Marvel Studios' 'Fantastic Four' reboot. Watts, who is known for directing Spider-Man movies, including 'Homecoming', 'Far From Home' and 'No Way Home', said he exited the film amid his decision to take a break from large scale superhero movies. He was announced as the director for 'Fantastic Four' reboot in December 2020.

186.title: Musk clearly a genius who thinks on another level: Twitter Co-founder
186.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Evan Williams has said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "clearly a genius who thinks on another level". However, he acknowledged Musk's polarising reputation, comparing him to the Web3 idea. "I think what we're also seeing is people project either their hopes and dreams or their worst nightmares. And it's like Elon and Web3 are the same," he added.

187.title: Two of Pune’s oldest schools switch to CBSE from state board
187.article_body: Two of the oldest schools in Pune, Dr Cyrus Poonawalla English Medium School and Motilal Talera English Medium School, have switched to Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) from state board this year. The schools are run by Camp Education Society (CES). The move was necessitated to stay updated with the current times, CES Chairman Walchand Sancheti said.

188.title: Rohini lake project will recharge 68 million litres of water daily: Jain
188.article_body: The Rohini lake project, which aims to recharge the lake with treated wastewater from the nearby Rohini sewage treatment plant (STP), is set to be completed within eight months, according to the Delhi Jal Board. "Eight lakes will receive and recharge 68 MLD (million litres per day) of treated water from the STP," Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain said.

189.title: Spain's Queen gifts grenades to Ukraine, sends sausages with victory note
189.article_body: The Queen of Spain put traditional sausages and a postcard wishing Ukraine victory over Russia in a shipment of grenades from her country. "I wish you victory! With love Leticia," the 49-year-old's message read, according to reports. She recently visited the Red Cross crisis unit in Madrid, which is one of the NGOs responsible for offering shelter to homeless Ukrainians.

190.title: Russian troops likely suffering ‘weakened morale’ in Ukraine: UK
190.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence said Russian forces are likely suffering from "weakened morale" as they face "considerable challenges in fighting" in Ukraine. "A lack of unit-level skills and inconsistent air support have left Russia unable to fully leverage its combat mass, despite localised improvements," the ministry said, adding, Russia hopes to reorganise its effort and shorten supply lines.

191.title: Ranbir misses Rishi a lot, there are days when I see tears in his eyes: Neetu
191.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, speaking on Rishi Kapoor's second death anniversary, said, "Ranbir (Kapoor) misses him a lot." "His mobile screensaver still has Rishi's photo. There are days when I see tears in his eyes but he stays strong," she added. "My kids and I celebrate his life by remembering all our fond memories," Neetu further said.

192.title: We got to be away from Gambhir when times are tough, jokes Manish Pandey
192.article_body: Speaking about LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir, LSG batter Manish Pandey jokingly said, "We got to be away from him when the times are tough." "He's quite a serious guy. I played with him [for] KKR a couple of years ago and have hardly seen him smile," added Manish. Manish has scored 88 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

193.title: Bowling at 155 kmph won't be a big thing for him: Umran's coach Randhir
193.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik's coach Randhir Singh said bowling at 155 kmph won't be a "big thing" for Umran if he keeps working hard. Umran's father Abdul Rashid stated that people said bowling fast does not mean everything when Umran didn't do well in two IPL 2022 matches. "Now the entire nation is showing him love," added Abdul.

194.title: Virat Kohli smashes his 1st fifty of IPL 2022, celebration goes viral
194.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli on Saturday smashed his first fifty of IPL 2022. The 33-year-old, who had scored 22 runs in his last five innings, reached the 50-run mark off 45 deliveries against GT. Kohli celebrated the fifty by looking up at the sky. Kohli's wife, actress Anushka Sharma, was also seen giving Kohli a standing ovation.

195.title: Political cartoon shared by Elon Musk listed as NFT, fetches bids of $3,550
195.article_body: A political cartoon that was recently shared by billionaire Elon Musk has been listed as an NFT (non-fungible token) by its creator Colin Wright. "The cartoon depicts the political landscape shifting beneath my feet, so that my once moderate left-wing views are now seen as right-wing and problematic," Wright said. The top bid for NFT is currently 1.25 Ether ($3,550).

196.title: 3 Army personnel injured as landmine explodes along LoC in J&K's Poonch
196.article_body: An Army officer was among three soldiers who sustained injuries in a landmine explosion while patrolling along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district. "The injured personnel have been evacuated and are undergoing treatment," a defence spokesperson said. The blast took place after the soldiers accidentally stepped on the landmine.

197.title: 25-yr-old woman thrown out of train after resisting molestation bid in MP, hospitalised
197.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh was allegedly thrown out of a running train by a man after she resisted his molestation attempt near Khajuraho in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district on Friday night, an official said. She was admitted to a hospital, where she is undergoing treatment. The accused has been identified and the police are about to arrest him.

198.title: Priyanka Chopra attends Vir Das' show in Los Angeles, calls him 'brave'
198.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra attended comedian Vir Das' show in Los Angeles on Friday. "Watching an awesome friend do what he does best! Vir Das, you are so brave and so inspiring to me!" Priyanka wrote on Instagram while sharing a few pictures from the show. "Thank you for opening...the doors for rest of us," Vir Das commented on her post.

199.title: US forces train Ukrainian troops in Germany: Department of Defense
199.article_body: The US Department of Defense on Friday said US forces are helping to train Ukrainian troops to learn advanced weapons systems in Germany. "We are thankful for Germany's continued support," spokesperson John Kirby said. He added the Florida National Guard is tasked with the "bulk" of the training. Kirby said training was also taking place in other parts of Europe.

200.title: 21 Naga People's Front MLAs in Nagaland join CM Neiphiu Rio's NDPP
200.article_body: As many as 21 out of 25 MLAs of the Naga People's Front (NPF) have joined Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio-led Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) in Nagaland. The state Assembly speaker Sharingain Longkumer approved the merger on Friday. Following the approval, NDPP now has 42 MLAs in the 60-member Assembly and NPF is left with four MLAs.

201.title: Man, woman in their 20s found dead on railway track in UP's Ballia
201.article_body: A man and a woman aged between 20 and 25 were found dead on the railway track on Uttar Pradesh's Ballia-Chhapra section of North Eastern Railway, police said. Their bodies were recovered from Manjhi rail bridge between Bakulha and Manjhi railway stations on Friday.  As per the station master of Bakulha, the deceased might have been hit by Sadbhavna Express.

202.title: Rowdy sheeter arrested for threatening a financier in Bengaluru
202.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested a rowdy sheeter, along with his nine accomplices, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Saturday. The accused threatened a financier with a lethal weapon and were plotting to rob him of lakhs of rupees, Gupta added. Police have seized lethal weapons and two bikes from them.

203.title: Akshaye Khanna joins Ajay Devgn, Tabu in 'Drishyam 2'
203.article_body: Akshaye Khanna has joined the cast of 'Drishyam 2', an upcoming film which is a remake of Mohanlal-starrer Malayalam film of the same name. Tabu took to Instagram to share the news, writing, "Delighted to have a gem of an actor on board." Ajay Devgn and Tabu will reprise their roles as Vijay Salgaonkar and Meera Deshmukh respectively.

204.title: For last 7-8 months, I've been working hard on my bowling: LSG's Krunal
204.article_body: After posting bowling figures of 4-1-11-2 in LSG's 20-run win against PBKS in IPL 2022, LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya said he's been working hard on his bowling for the past seven-eight months. "Special mention to Rahul Sanghvi. The results everyone can see as I've tried to improve skillwise," he added. Krunal has taken nine wickets from nine matches so far.

205.title: Dravid interacts with Northeast, Plate group cricketers at NCA
205.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid interacted with cricketers from the Northeast states and the Plate group teams at the Bengaluru-based National Cricket Academy on Friday. Former India cricketer VVS Laxman, who was present during the interactive session, tweeted, "I am sure the boys would have welcomed the chance to take a peek into Rahul's mind."

206.title: Kerala Catholic priest gets 18-year jail for sexually abusing minor seminarians
206.article_body: A POCSO court in Kerala's Kollam district has sentenced a Catholic priest to 18 years of imprisonment after he was found guilty of sexually abusing four minor seminarians. The court also ordered the priest to pay a fine of ₹1 lakh. The seminarians were reportedly staying with him at a rented house at Kottathala, where the crimes had taken place.

207.title: April's avg maximum temperature was highest in 122 years in parts of India: IMD
207.article_body: The average maximum temperature over northwest and central India for April 2022 was the highest in 122 years, as per IMD data available on April 28. Northwest India recorded an average maximum temperature of 35.9 degrees Celsius which was 3.35 degrees above the normal long-period average. Over central India, the average maximum temperature in April was 37.78 degrees Celsius.

208.title: Ambulance service for cows launched in Assam's Dibrugarh
208.article_body: An ambulance service exclusively for cows was inaugurated in Assam's Dibrugarh district. "The ambulance service will pave the way for the speedy treatment of...injured cows," Dibrugarh Deputy Commissioner Biswajit Pegu said while launching the service. Notably, the service will be run by an NGO, Gopal Gaushala, which claims that it is the first cow ambulance service in the entire Northeast.

209.title: Stuart and I were hoping our careers weren't over: James Anderson
209.article_body: England seamer James Anderson has said that he and fellow pacer Stuart Broad were "hoping" that their "careers weren't over" after the duo were dropped from the Test squad for the West Indies tour. "So it's nice to hear there's a chance," Anderson said after being named, along with Broad, in the squad for the upcoming series against New Zealand.

210.title: Balasaheb must be happy seeing us fight against those trying to divide India: Raut
210.article_body: Reacting to Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey's "Bal Thackeray's soul would have been hurt seeing people getting arrested for reciting Hanuman Chalisa" remark, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said, "They don't have to worry about Balasaheb ji." "Balasaheb will surely be happy to see that Shiv Sena is fighting against those who are...dividing the country and defaming Maharashtra," Raut added.

211.title: Noida Police launch drive against drunk driving, inspect 2,000 people
211.article_body: Noida Traffic Police has launched a drive against drunk driving and consuming alcohol in public places and inspected over 2,000 people on Thursday. According to a police spokesperson, 63 people were booked for allegedly creating a public nuisance. Police said driving cases are becoming more common across Noida and Greater Noida, adding, "We get...25-35 cases of drink driving every night."

212.title: Man receives challan for 'not wearing helmet properly' in car in Kerala
212.article_body: In an apparent goof-up, Kerala Traffic Police fined a car owner ₹500 for not wearing a 'helmet properly'. The error seems to have occurred as the registration number of the motorbike, the image of which is attached to the challan, is similar to that of the car. Police said it could be the result of a clerical or typographical error.

213.title: Will continue to focus on plans: Mohsin Khan after picking 3 scalps vs PBKS
213.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants pacer Mohsin Khan has said that he will continue to "focus on the plans" after the 23-year-old cricketer picked up three wickets in the 20-run win over Punjab Kings. "He (KL Rahul) said that I have to do what I have been doing for so long...The entire team backs and supports each other," Khan said.

214.title: We just kept losing wickets, it's disappointing: Mayank Agarwal
214.article_body: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal has criticised his side's batters after their 20-run loss against the Lucknow Super Giants. "I think we just kept losing wickets. We had batsmen who were set and we kept getting out. So many soft dismissals," Agarwal said. "It is disappointing...we have to face the truth...We were below par with the bat," he added.

215.title: 45,773 loudspeakers removed from various religious places: UP Police
215.article_body: As many as 45,773 loudspeakers have been removed from various religious places across the state, Uttar Pradesh's Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said. The sound level of 58,861 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters, he added. All districts have been asked to submit a compliance report by April 30.

216.title: Putin may declare all-out war on Ukraine on May 9: Reports
216.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin could declare all-out war on Ukraine as a "payback" over his military's failures during the invasion, reports quoting Russian and Western officials stated. The reports claimed that the announcement could come on May 9, when Russia celebrates the victory of the Soviet army over Nazi Germany. Putin had termed invasion of Ukraine as 'special operation'.

217.title: Our home has become eerily quiet after Lata didi's death: Usha Mangeshkar
217.article_body: Singer Usha Mangeshkar, sister of late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, said, "After her (Lata) passing forth into the other world, our home, Prabhu Kunj has gone eerily quiet." "While she was there, people were in and out of our home constantly. Besides, there were several nurses and house-helps to look after her. Now it's just me in house," Usha added.

218.title: South Africa may be entering 5th wave of COVID-19: Health Minister
218.article_body: Health Minister Joe Phaahla said South Africa may be entering its fifth wave of COVID-19. The Omicron variant of COVID-19 was first reported in South Africa last November. The country has reported over 3.7 million cases and over 100,000 deaths since the pandemic began. Phaahla added South Africa has already passed the threshold of 6,237 new cases per day.

219.title: You'll always be my Captain: Musk as Shatner says 'hire me as Twitter's face'
219.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "You will always be my Captain," after actor William Shatner asked Musk to hire him "as the face of Twitter". The 91-year-old played the role of Captain James T Kirk of USS Enterprise in 'Star Trek' franchise. Shatner also wrote, "Since it seems to be the latest "thing"...I'm stating that I'm staying on Twitter."

220.title: Mohammad Shami uses tape to measure his run-up in between over, umpire talks to him
220.article_body: GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami called for a measuring tape to mark his run-up after bowling just one delivery against RCB in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. The umpire was seen talking to Shami, seemingly unhappy with the delay. Before measuring the run-up, Shami had a couple of false starts.

221.title: 6 severely injured after DTC bus crashes into roadside shops in Delhi's Jangpura
221.article_body: At least six persons were severely injured after a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus crashed into roadside shops in Delhi's Jangpura on Saturday, police said. "The bus was going towards Jangpura from the Sarai Kale Khan area. The driver of the bus lost control," an officer said. Following the accident, the area reportedly witnessed a massive traffic jam.

222.title: Kim Kardashian cleared of defamation charges against Blac Chyna
222.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian was on Friday cleared of defamation charges against Blac Chyna. A Los Angeles court concluded Kim made "no statement" that was "alleged to be defamatory" against Chyna, reports said. This comes after Blac Chyna sued the Kardashian-Jenner family for purposefully interfering with her contract on the Rob and Chyna spin-off of 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians'.

223.title: Part of bridge caves in after rodents dig soil underneath in Punjab
223.article_body: A portion of the footpath on the Jagraon Bridge in Punjab's Ludhiana caved in after rodents dug the soil and excavated the area underneath, according to officials. The district's Additional Deputy Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal inspected the area on Friday with other officials and ordered its immediate repair. The matter came to light after an activist posted about it online.

224.title: B'luru likely to see rains, thundershowers over next few days: IMD
224.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Bengaluru city is likely to witness scattered rainfall in the coming days. The weather department said the city is likely to witness partly cloudy sky, rain and thundershowers from May 1 to May 6. Reportedly, Bengaluru witnessed the hottest day of the year on April 29 with the city's maximum temperature touching 35.2°C.

225.title: Surprised: De Kock on LSG's 20-run win after posting 153/8 vs PBKS
225.article_body: LSG wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock said he was surprised by his side's 20-run win against PBKS in IPL 2022, adding they couldn't put up a total they wanted to. "But the guys bowled really well. We have got a lot to thank them for," he added. Asked to bat first, LSG posted 153/8 in 20 overs.

226.title: Mental health issues in kids rose during pandemic: Study
226.article_body: Based on an analysis of 17 studies, researchers have found that mental issues in children rose during COVID-19 pandemic. "In many places, schools,...mental health resources...became unavailable...making it difficult for children...to receive timely mental healthcare," a researcher said. High rates of anxiety, depression, sleep disorders, suicidal behaviour, etc. were reported during this period.

227.title: Bihar Police cautions people as fraudsters steal money in name of electricity bill
227.article_body: The Bihar Police has cautioned people against responding to messages from cyber fraudsters asking people to pay money claiming that their previous month's electricity bill wasn't updated. The fraudsters ask people to contact a number provided in the message, the police said. The caution comes after several people including ex-Bihar Police Chief and a HC judge received such messages.

228.title: Month of May to see fewer heatwaves over major parts of country: IMD
228.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Saturday forecasted fewer heatwaves and below normal maximum temperatures for the month of May over major parts of the country. However, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Delhi, Haryana, Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh will continue to experience heatwave to severe heatwave conditions during the month, the IMD added.

229.title: The word 'metaverse' is hypothetical, we don't use it: Snap CEO
229.article_body: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has said his company doesn't use the word "metaverse" because it's "pretty ambiguous and hypothetical". He said, "Just ask a room of people how to define it, and everyone's definition is...different." "When we talk about AR, we're trying to augment the real world around you. Our fundamental bet is that people...love the real world," he added.

230.title: ₹5,551 crore seized from Xiaomi India bank accounts for forex violations: ED
230.article_body: Assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited have been seized in connection with "illegal outward remittances made by the company", the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Saturday. The assets lying in bank accounts have been seized under provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999, the agency added.

231.title: PMC to resume toy train services in Pune gardens after gap of 2 yrs
231.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to resume the toy train services in its gardens in the city after a gap of about two years. The vehicle depot has been asked to start the trains as early as possible in the wake of approaching school vacations, a senior official said. The toy trains will be operated at five gardens.

232.title: It's a victory of truth: Vivek as Kashmir Files completes 50 days in theatres
232.article_body:
Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', which was released on March 11, has completed 50 days in theatres. Taking to Twitter, Vivek wrote, "It's a victory of Truth. It's a victory of Humanity. It's truly a people's film. Thanks, everyone. #RightToJustice." It starred Anupam Kher, 
Pallavi Joshi, Mithun Chakraborty and Darshan Kumaar among others in pivotal roles.

233.title: SpaceX apologises for 'falling behind' in Starlink customer support
233.article_body: SpaceX has apologised to some customers for falling behind in its response time in Starlink customer support. "This is not the level of support we aim to provide," it said in a message posted on Reddit by a customer. Starlink added there may be an "unusual delay" before they reply to customers and someone from the team will respond "eventually".

234.title: CBI raids 8 locations in Mumbai, Pune over Yes Bank-DHFL fraud case
234.article_body: CBI on Saturday conducted raids at eight locations in Mumbai and Pune in connection with a fraud case related to Yes Bank and Dewan Housing Finance Limited. Searches were conducted at the premises linked to Pune-based businessman Avinash Bhosale & Mumbai's prominent real estate developers Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. Reportedly, they've close links with the Shiv Sena-led Maharashtra government.

235.title: RCB to bat first against GT, Hardik Pandya featuring in his 100th IPL match
235.article_body: RCB won the toss and elected to bat first against GT in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. GT captain Hardik Pandya is featuring in his 100th IPL match. GT have made two changes, with Pradeep Sangwan and Sai Sudharsan replacing Yash Dayal and Abhinav Manohar, respectively. Meanwhile, Mahipal Lomror has replaced Suyash Prabhudessai in RCB's playing XI.

236.title: Munich’s Oktoberfest to return without COVID-19 restrictions: Mayor
236.article_body: Munich's Mayor Dieter Reiter on Friday said Oktoberfest, the world's largest annual beer festival, will return in 2022 without any COVID-19 restrictions. It was cancelled the previous two years due to COVID-19. The festival usually attracts over six million people to Munich each year. Reiter added he told the festival's management to go ahead "without delay and without restrictions".

237.title: I could have done things differently: CEO Parag on Twitter's past performance
237.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal acknowledged during a company-wide meeting that the microblogging site could have performed better over the years. "Yes, we could have done things differently and better. I could have done things differently. I think about that a lot," Agrawal said. He also urged the company's staff to expect change in the future under new leadership.

238.title: Unlike actors, we can't choose our songs in films: Shalmali Kholgade
238.article_body: Shalmali Kholgade, in a recent interview, said singers don't have an option of choosing their songs in films. "We can turn a song down if...we are not comfortable singing the lyrics, but we cannot equate it to actors choosing to take up a role," Shalmali said. She added that many singers nowadays don't know who they are singing for.

239.title: Over 1 million people evacuated from Ukraine to Russia: Lavrov
239.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Saturday said over one million people have been evacuated to Russia from Ukraine since February 24, which is when Russia's invasion of Ukraine began. Lavrov said the 1.02 million includes 120,000 foreigners. Lavrov added that 2.8 million people in Ukraine have asked to be evacuated into Russia.

240.title: Making efforts so youth of ordinary families become entrepreneurs: PM Modi
240.article_body: Speaking at the inauguration of Global Patidar Business Summit (GPBS), Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the government has been making constant efforts through its policies for the past eight years to help the youth of ordinary families become entrepreneurs. "We just have to boost our self-confidence. This...will come only when there's participation of everyone in development," he said.

241.title: Netflix fires staff months after hiring them, offers 2 weeks of severance pay
241.article_body: Netflix confirmed to Fortune that it has fired 25 employees from its marketing department, including 10-12 writers and editors from its in-house publication Tudum. Several of these writers tweeted that they were fired just months after being hired with the promise of more stability. A fired Netflix employee tweeted the company offered two weeks of severance pay to fired workers.

242.title: PMC urges eligible citizens to get 2nd COVID vaccine dose at earliest
242.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has appealed to all eligible citizens to get their second COVID-19 vaccine dose at the earliest to protect themselves from a possible next wave of the virus. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar also urged the citizens eligible for the precaution dose to take it. Reportedly, about five lakh persons are yet to complete their vaccination process in Pune.

243.title: SC orders release of detained Pak man who got married, had 5 kids in India
243.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday ordered the release of a 62-year-old Pakistani man who's in a detention centre for overstaying his visa on a personal bond of ₹5,000 and two sureties. The man had entered India on a visa in 1989-90, got married and had five children. The court directed the Centre to decide on granting the man a long-term visa.

244.title: Musk made $500,000 donation in Amber's name after her divorce settlement, court told
244.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's fund is believed to have made a $500,000 donation to American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) in his ex-girlfriend Amber Heard's name, the actress' defamation trial was told. The amount was almost half the donation that Heard has made to the charity. She had pledged to give away her $7 million divorce settlement with Johnny Depp.

245.title: Took risk of quitting Shiv Sena for benefit of OBCs: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal
245.article_body: NCP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chhagan Bhujbal said that he took a big risk by quitting Shiv Sena and joining Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) for the sake of the Other Backward Classes (OBCs). "For the last several years, I have been working for the OBC community. I risked my political career for their benefit and switched over," he said.

246.title: Pune railway station to get 107 more CCTV cameras for enhanced vigilance
246.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) is going to add 107 CCTV cameras at Pune railway station. At least 61 cameras are already present at the station premises. "We have cracked several cases with the help of CCTV cameras till now, and adding more cameras will help to improve our vigilance and crime detection," a senior police inspector said.

247.title: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos loses over $20 billion in a day
247.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos lost around $20.5 billion in a day after Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015, with net loss of $3.8 billion in first quarter of 2022. Bezos, the world's second richest person according to Bloomberg, is now reportedly the third biggest wealth loser this year, with his fortune dropping nearly $44 billion since January 1.

248.title: AIMIM leader held in Hubballi violence case attempts suicide in custody
248.article_body: AIMIM leader Mohammed Arif Nagral, who was arrested in connection with the Karnataka's Hubballi violence, attempted suicide in police custody by consuming turpentine, ANI reported. He was hospitalised following the incident and is undergoing treatment in Hubballi's KIMS Hospital. A stone-pelting incident took place at Old Hubballi Police Station on April 16, in which 12 policemen were injured.

249.title: Comic book artist Neal Adams, who drew Batman & Avengers, dies at 80
249.article_body: Neal Adams, the comic book artist who drew superhero characters like Batman, Green Arrow, Green Lantern, the Avengers and several others, passed away aged 80 on Thursday. He died in New York of complications from sepsis, his wife told Hollywood Reporter. In a statement, DC Comics called Neal "one of the most acclaimed artists to have contributed to...comic book industry".

250.title: He should be paying Mike for that punch: Fury on Tyson punching a man
250.article_body: Reacting to a video of American boxing legend Mike Tyson punching a fellow passenger on a flight, British boxer Tyson Fury said, "[The passenger] should be paying Mike. He can say he's been punched...by a legend." "I would pay for that myself," added Fury. "If he's man enough to...touch...and abuse Tyson, then...take a punch in the face," stated Fury.

251.title: After Weibo, China's WeChat to reveal user locations on posts
251.article_body: China's messaging service WeChat has said it will start revealing the location of users when they post on a public account. It will soon begin testing the setting which applies only to users of its "public platform", where they may comment on content published by official accounts. This comes right after Weibo started publishing users' IP locations.

252.title: ED attaches Jacqueline's ₹7-crore FD in case involving conman Sukesh: Reports
252.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached Jacqueline Fernandez's ₹7-crore fixed deposit in money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, according to reports. Last year, ED said Sukesh gifted three Gucci and Chanel bags, two Gucci outfits, two pairs of diamond earrings and two Hermes bracelets to her. She also received a Mini Cooper, which she returned, according to ED.

253.title: The current Man Utd squad needs an open-heart surgery: Gary Neville
253.article_body: Talking about the current Manchester United squad, ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said, "I still can't believe [that] going from a European Cup final last year and finishing second, that open-heart surgery is needed...but it quite simply is." "There is no certainty anymore," added Neville. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League points table.

254.title: PV Sindhu wins bronze medal at Badminton Asia Championships
254.article_body: World number seven PV Sindhu has won a bronze medal in the 2022 Badminton Asia Championships following a defeat in the semi-finals of the tournament, against Japanese defending champion Akane Yamaguchi. Yamaguchi defeated Sindhu 13-21, 21-19, 21-16. Sindhu had won a bronze medal at the 2014 edition of the tournament in Gimcheon as well.

255.title: Far-right US activist told he may get his Twitter account back soon: WSJ
255.article_body: Charles Johnson, a far-right activist in the US, has been told by a close associate of Elon Musk that he may "soon" get his account back after Musk buys Twitter, according to a Wall Street Journal report. Johnson was banned from Twitter in 2015 after he used the platform to fundraise to "take out" Black Lives Matter activist DeRay McKesson.

256.title: Don't tell reason, solve the problem: Akhilesh to UP govt on power crisis
256.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the UP government for "telling reasons" instead of solving the power crisis problem in the state. Yadav said this by tweeting an excerpt of information shared by state's Urban Development & Energy Minister AK Sharma which revealed the closure of a few power generation units in the state due to technical reasons.

257.title: 3 children of a Surat-based slum locality drown in Tapi river
257.article_body: Three children drowned while playing on the bank of the Tapi river in Surat, Gujarat. The three deceased, who were residents of the Iqbal Nagar slum area, were identified as Mohammad Fakir (7), Shahadat Fakir (8) and Sania Sheikh (14). "The trio drowned due to a sudden rise in the river's water level near the causeway," a police official said.

258.title: Acid attack on 24-yr-old woman in B'luru is barbarous: K'taka Min
258.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Saturday called the acid attack on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru "barbarous". "Police expressed confidence that they'll be arresting the accused in a day or two. [State government] will look after victim's treatment," he said. Reportedly, the accused had stalked the woman for years and had attacked her after she refused his marriage proposal.

259.title: Apple sued in Russia for pulling its payment service amid war
259.article_body: Russian law firm Chernyshov, Lukoyanov & Partners has sued Apple seeking $1.28 million in damages for consumers affected by Apple withdrawing its payment service from Russia amid the Ukrainian war. The demand includes compensation for "moral damage" caused to citizens. The total figure could rise as the law firm is still inviting more claimants to join the suit.

260.title: Maharashtra's 1st child-friendly room started at Pune rly station
260.article_body: Maharashtra's first child-friendly room or counselling room was launched at Pune railway station on Friday by the district's Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Renu Sharma. This was done in a bid to provide help to 'runaway' or missing children. "This is the first step towards making our stations free of any kind of child trafficking or violence," Sharma said.

261.title: 7 held for a road brawl in Delhi over petty issue: Police
261.article_body: Delhi Police arrested seven men for allegedly assaulting each other and injuring two passers-by in a road brawl on Thursday near a school in northwest Delhi's Shakurpur area. While locals alleged they were involved in stone-pelting and communal hatred, police confirmed it was just a fight over a petty issue. The injured were taken to a hospital and discharged later.

262.title: Rohit Shetty to make biopic on ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria
262.article_body: Rohit Shetty announced on Saturday that he will be producing a biopic on former Mumbai Police Commissioner Rakesh Maria. "Feel honoured to be bringing this real-life supercop's journey to screen," Rohit wrote on Instagram. Rakesh Maria is a 1981 batch IPS officer who cracked the Bombay serial blasts case in 1993 and investigated the 26/11 Mumbai attacks.

263.title: No COVID testing, vaccination certificates for Char Dham Yatra: U'khand govt
263.article_body: It is not mandatory for the Char Dham Yatra passengers and devotees arriving from the state borders to undergo COVID-19 testing or present a COVID-19 vaccination certificate, an official confirmed. It's, however, mandatory for all the devotees to register on the state's tourism portal before their arrival, the official added. The Char Dham Yatra commences on May 3.

264.title: UP man kidnaps own granddaughter to 'gift' to his lover
264.article_body: A 56-year-old man from UP's Bijnor who works as a daily wager in Delhi kidnapped his one-month-old granddaughter and allegedly "gifted" her to a married and childless woman with whom he was having an affair. The woman had reportedly expressed her wish to adopt a baby to the accused identified as Mohd Zafar. The accused has now been arrested.

265.title: SRK's Knight Riders, MLC plan to build ₹230-crore cricket stadium in US
265.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's Knight Riders Group and Major League Cricket (MLC) are teaming up for plans to construct a cricket stadium in Southern California. The proposed site of the stadium is at Great Park in Irvine City, which is over 60 km southeast of downtown Los Angeles. The venue is expected to cost around $30 million (over ₹230 crore).

266.title: Willing to take over debt-ridden CR Park school: Delhi govt to HC
266.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that it is willing to take over the debt-ridden CR Park's Raisina Bengali School. A request has been made to the Comptroller and Auditor General to conduct an audit, it added. "If it's found...that money has been...diverted to somewhere else from the school account, very strict action will be taken," Delhi government stated.

267.title: General Manoj Pande takes over as 29th Chief of Army Staff from General MM Naravane
267.article_body: General Manoj Pande, PVSM, AVSM, VSM, ADC took over as the 29th Chief of Army Staff from General MM Naravane on Saturday. He is the first Corps of Engineers officer to hold the post. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, he was commissioned in the Corps of Engineers (Bombay Sappers) in December 1982.

268.title: One should be mindful of the 'Lakshman Rekha' while discharging their duty: CJI
268.article_body: While speaking at the Joint Conference of Chief Ministers and Chief Justices of High Courts, which was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi, Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said one should be mindful of the 'Lakshman Rekha' while discharging their duty. "Constitution provides separation of power among three organs and the harmonious function between three organs strengthens democracy," he added.

269.title: Largest-known tooth from any ichthyosaur found in Swiss Alps
269.article_body: Palaeontologists have discovered sets of fossils, unearthed in the Swiss Alps between 1976 and 1990, representing three new ichthyosaurs that may have been among the largest animals to have ever lived. The discovery includes the largest ichthyosaur tooth ever found. The tooth has a 2.4 inches wide base and an estimated length of 6 inches.

270.title: BMC to screen people with influenza, respiratory ailments for COVID-19
270.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to screen people with influenza-like-illness (ILI) and severe acute respiratory illness (SARI) for the virus. "The samples will also be sent for whole-genome sequencing," an official said. Moreover, the BMC is also planning to screen vegetable vendors, hawkers, auto drivers and shopkeepers.

271.title: He has become a fake astrologer: BJP leader on Rahul's coal crisis remarks
271.article_body: BJP leader Pralhad Joshi criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his remarks on India's coal crisis and called him a "fake astrologer". "Instead of telling what is going to happen due to coal shortage in the country, he should tell the country how big a coal scam happened during his government and how much loss the country incurred," Joshi added.

272.title: PIL has become 'Personal Interest Litigation', being used to stall projects: CJI
272.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said that Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has now become 'Personal Interest Litigation' and is being used to stall projects and terrorise public authorities. "It has become a tool to settle scores with political and corporate rivals," he added. CJI was speaking at the Joint Conference of Chief Ministers and Chief Justices of High Courts.

273.title: It's an important occasion: Shaan on hosting 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti'
273.article_body: Singer Shaan, who has been roped in to host 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti', spoke about why he agreed to be a part of show and said, "The real reason is...it's Mika's swayamvar." He added that Mika wants to get married and settle down. "It's an important occasion...With a genuine intention, we all...are coming forward to do this," Shaan said.

274.title: 39 people including 17 tourists injured in stray dog attack in Srinagar
274.article_body: As many as 39 people were injured in an alleged attack by stray dogs at the Dalgate area in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Friday. The injured, including 17 tourists and 22 locals, were shifted to hospital, local eyewitnesses said. People have appealed to the authorities to act against the rising dog menace in the city.

275.title: Russians were 'minutes away' from capturing Ukraine President, his family: Official
275.article_body: Russian soldiers were "minutes away" from capturing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his family in the first hours of the war, his Chief of Staff Andriy Yermak has said. The military informed Zelenskyy that Russian strike teams had parachuted into capital Kyiv. "Before that night, we had only ever seen such things in the movies," Yermak added.

276.title: When I spoke to Rohit Sharma, he seemed a broken man: Ian Bishop on MI's performance
276.article_body: Talking about MI's winless run in IPL 2022, cricketer-turned-commentator Ian Bishop said, "When I spoke to Rohit Sharma after the last game, he seemed a broken man." Bishop added, "It's a franchise with great pedigree. I think they need some personnel changes." He stated, "They need someone...to get them to a more significant score to hold things...and maybe power up."

277.title: Losing a partner of 45 years was painful: Neetu on Rishi's death anniversary
277.article_body: Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to pen a note remembering her late husband Rishi Kapoor on his second death anniversary. She shared a video from sets of 'Dance Deewane Juniors' and wrote, "Losing a partner of 45 years was...painful at that time the only way to heal my heart was to keep myself...occupied...Movies, television helped me achieve that."

278.title: Johar shares BTS video of Ranveer, Saif's son Ibrahim from 'Rocky...' set
278.article_body: Karan Johar, taking to Instagram Stories, shared a behind-the-scenes video from set of 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', which stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt. In the video, Ranveer can be seen sitting in a car and Saif Ali Khan's son Ibrahim can be seen standing next to Ranveer's car. Ibrahim is working as assistant director on the film.

279.title: Chidambaram criticises Centre over power crisis, says 'Modi hai, mumkin hai'
279.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday criticised the Centre over the power crisis in the country. "Government has found the perfect solution: cancel passenger trains and run coal rakes! Modi hai, mumkin hai," the former Union Minister tweeted. Chidambaram further alleged that the country is facing acute power shortage despite having a large railway network and abundant coal.

280.title: If Bayern don't want to sell you, you're fu****: Martinez on Lewandowski
280.article_body: Talking about Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski, ex-Bayern Munich midfielder Javi Martínez said, "If Bayern don’t want to sell you, you are fu**** because there are no release clauses. There is a possibility Lewandowski goes to Barcelona." "Lewandowski believes he would have won a Ballon d'Or or two if he played in Spain," added Martínez.

281.title: Himachal Pradesh Police burns drugs worth ₹16 crore; pics surface
281.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Police on Friday destroyed drugs worth over ₹16 crores in Kullu and shared pictures of state DGP Sanjay Kundu burning the contraband. The police said that 160.3 kg of cannabis, 120 cannabis plants and 80 opium plants were destroyed. Kundu said that the police want to tell drug smugglers that "there is no future in the 'black' business."

282.title: 96% of daily COVID-19 cases in Karnataka recorded in Bengaluru
282.article_body: About 96% of the daily coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka on Friday were recorded in Bengaluru, according to state health department data. Bengaluru Urban and Bengaluru Rural reported 127 and one daily cases, respectively, the data showed. According to BBMP data, the positivity rate in the district was at 3.2% and the number of new coronavirus tests done was 3,970.

283.title: Ronaldo dreamt of UCL win at Juventus but they lacked something: Carvalho
283.article_body: Former Chelsea defender Ricardo Carvalho said Cristiano Ronaldo's dream was to win the UEFA Champions League while representing Juventus, but they "lacked something" to win the tournament. "The...team's strength is not enough to win the UEFA Champions League, a competition made of details," added Carvalho. Ronaldo won the UEFA Champions League while playing for Real Madrid and Manchester United.

284.title: BJP, PFI are behind Hubballi violence: Congress' DK Shivakumar
284.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has accused the BJP and the Popular Front of India (PFI) of staging violence in Hubballi. "BJP and PFI are behind (the) Hubli riots. Congress does not support (the) Bajrang Dal, VHP, SDPI, or any organisation that creates unrest in society. We are strongly committed to the Constitution," Shivakumar tweeted.

285.title: Biden's new Disinformation Governance Board compared to Orwell's 'Ministry of Truth'
285.article_body: The Joe Biden administration has announced the creation of Disinformation Governance Board. The US President's critics compared it to 'Ministry of Truth' in George Orwell's novel Nineteen Eighty-Four. "The spread of disinformation can affect border security, Americans' safety during disasters, and public trust in our democratic institutions," the Department of Homeland Security said.

286.title: Far-left hates everyone, I'm no fan of the far-right either: Musk
286.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "The far-left hates everyone, themselves included!" He added that he is "no fan of the far-right either". "Let's have less hate and more love," he further said. Musk's tweets follow his previous statement on making Twitter a "politically neutral" platform to earn the public's trust.

287.title: Ex-AAP councillor, 9 other women jailed for 7 yrs in 2015 stone-pelting case in Gurugram
287.article_body: Former Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) councillor Nisha Singh and nine other women have been awarded seven years of rigorous imprisonment for pelting stones at an Urban Housing Development Authority team in Haryana's Gurugram in 2015. Another seven convicts in the case have been awarded 10 years in jail. Notably, two more accused in the case died during the trial.

288.title: Some players are on their ego, want to only play their way: Ojha on PBKS
288.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said PBKS' players are "not learning" from their mistakes, adding that some players are "on their ego, claiming that they will only play their way". Discussing PBKS' fifth loss in IPL 2022 following a defeat against LSG by 20 runs, Ojha stated, "From PBKS' perspective, these are the games...you have to win at all costs."

289.title: Haryana govt did not set up a power plant, demolished 4: Surjewala
289.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has criticised the BJP-JJP-led Haryana government over the electricity crisis issue. "This (Haryana) government did not set up a single power plant in the last eight years and demolished four functional power plants," Surjewala said. "The CM's announcement of a new power plant...sounds like digging a well when the house is on fire," he added.

290.title: Gang murders trans person after verbal fight in Bengaluru
290.article_body: A five-member gang allegedly murdered a 23-year-old transgender person after a verbal fight broke out between them. The accused had allegedly beaten the victim Anika with wooden logs, and she later succumbed to her injuries. Anika had asked them for some money which led to them mocking her for begging after which Anika lost her cool which turned into argument.

291.title: Singer Tarsame Singh Saini, whose hit songs include 'Nachange Saari Raat', dies aged 54
291.article_body: Singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, passed away aged 54. The singer reportedly suffered a liver failure following which he had slipped into a coma. He was the lead singer of the pop band Stereo Nation. His hit songs included 'Pyar Ho Gaya' and 'Nachange Saari Raat', among others.

292.title: Stop hitting on me: Musk to US politician on 'billionaire with ego problem' tweet
292.article_body: After US' Democratic congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez took to Twitter and blamed hate crimes on "some billionaire with ego problem" who "unilaterally controls a massive communication platform", Elon Musk tweeted, "Stop hitting on me, I'm really shy." Alexandria replied, "I was talking about Zuckerberg, but ok," before deleting it. Musk recently reached a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

293.title: Kishan seems under a lot of pressure, he has gone into a shell: Chawla
293.article_body: Sharing his opinion on MI opener Ishan Kishan, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said, "Although he made a good start in MI's first two IPL 2022 matches, he has gone into a shell after that." "Kishan seems under a lot of pressure," added Chawla. "I have never seen him like this...He's playing a lot of balls and not scoring runs," stated Chawla.

294.title: Flooding is a man-made disaster, result of failed planning: BMC Ex-Commissioner
294.article_body: "Flooding is a man-made disaster," said Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) former Municipal Commissioner Ajoy Mehta at consultative session on 'Flood in Mumbai'. "We must all realise that flooding is a planning disaster. It happens because...your planning goes wrong," Mehta said. "Since it's man-made, it requires man-made solutions...this disaster impacts poor people the most," he added.

295.title: Man lets relatives gangrape wife over dowry in Raj; says 'Will make money off your video'
295.article_body: A Rajasthan man allegedly got his wife gangraped by his relatives after her family failed to pay him a dowry of ₹1.5 lakh. He filmed video of the gangrape and uploaded it online. "Your family members could not give me dowry, but now I will earn the same amount by putting this video on YouTube," the man told his wife.

296.title: Meta appeals against ban for 'extremist' acts in Russia: Report
296.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has appealed to a Russian court against a ban imposed on some of its activities in Russia due to "extremism", Interfax news agency reported citing a press release. Russia in March found Meta guilty of "extremist activity". However, it said the ruling wouldn't affect its WhatsApp messenger service in the country.

297.title: Punjab declares summer vacation in all schools from May 14 amid heatwave
297.article_body: Punjab government has declared summer vacation in all schools from May 14 amid heatwave in the state. The decision has been taken after the suggestions of thousands of parents and teachers, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said. Notably, Bathinda and Patiala on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 44°C and 43.4°C respectively. The maximum temperature in Amritsar stood at 42.3°C.

298.title: Was confused & overconfident: Kangana shares throwback pic from 'Gangster' set
298.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, who made her debut in 2006 with film 'Gangster', took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture of herself from the set of the Anurag Basu directorial film. "Throwback picture of me from Gangster days. I was just a teenager lost, confused and overconfident," she captioned the picture. 'Gangster' completed 16 years of release on April 28.

299.title: IT engineer looking for rented house cheated of ₹1.16 lakh in Mumbai
299.article_body: A 23-year-old IT engineer lost ₹1.16 lakh while looking for rented accommodation in Mumbai's Andheri East area. The victim had signed up on a real estate website following which he received a call from the accused. The caller sent him property pictures and demanded ₹2,000 as token money. He then induced the victim to transfer more money as other charges.

300.title: 19-yr-old girl, 2 others murder her 40-yr-old former lover in Pune
300.article_body: Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested a 19-year-old girl and her two associates for allegedly conspiring and murdering her 40-year-old former lover. The deceased, who is married, had reportedly intervened when the girl and one of the accused started going out. The trio apparently took the deceased to a deserted area and attacked him with a stone and iron pipe.

301.title: Chennai man gets death penalty for raping minor daughter, mother gets life term
301.article_body: A Special POCSO Court on Friday awarded death penalty to a man for sexually assaulting his minor daughter for about eight years till she was 15 in Chennai and sentenced the victim's mother to life imprisonment. The mother, despite knowing about the harassment, had allegedly warned her daughter of dire consequences if she revealed the matter to anyone.

302.title: Gang takes selfie with body after beating man to death in TN; held
302.article_body: A gang of four men were arrested in Tamil Nadu's Chennai after they allegedly beat a man to death with liquor bottles and then took a selfie with the body. The accused had reportedly killed the deceased over previous enmity and later shared the picture on WhatsApp to prove the murder to their friends. The arrests were made on Thursday.

303.title: Tourists ditching Himachal, rushing towards Kashmir, U'khand: Experts
303.article_body: Tourism experts said the hotels in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla have seen a sharp fall of about 60-70% in April as compared to occupancies in the pre-COVID years, following a drastic decline in the tourist footfall. Tourists are rushing towards more attractive spots in Kashmir and Uttarakhand as Himachal Pradesh has failed to publicise its lesser-explored destinations, they added.

304.title: After contracting COVID-19 twice during pregnancy, Mumbai woman delivers healthy baby
304.article_body: A 31-year-old Mumbai-based woman delivered a healthy baby at Wockhardt Hospital after she contracted COVID-19 twice during her pregnancy. She first tested COVID-19 positive during her second month of pregnancy and the second time during the sixth month. The hospital's doctor called it a "complex pregnancy" as the woman conceived five times in the past seven years, but suffered miscarriages.

305.title: Court criticises Assam Police for filing 'false FIR' against Mevani
305.article_body: A court in Assam on Friday criticised the state police for filing a "false FIR" against Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a policewoman assault case. It also called on Gauhati High Court to direct the police to "reform itself". The court observed that if this isn't done then, "our state will become a police state which the society can ill-afford".

306.title: Work on Hyderabad Regional Ring Road to begin in 3 months: Gadkari
306.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said the work on the Regional Ring Road (RRR) around Hyderabad will begin in three months. The northern part of the road has already been sanctioned by Centre and a Detailed Project Report (DPR) is in the final stages, he added. The proposed road will have a length of about 340 km.

307.title: 17 lakh Fitbit watches recall doesn't cover all burn-causing models: Lawsuit
307.article_body: A lawsuit has claimed that Fitbit's recent US recall of 17 lakh of its Ionic smartwatches, over reports that overheating batteries caused burn injuries, doesn't cover all similar defective models. Other versions of the device also burn users and can burst into flames, two women claimed. "Reasonable consumers...purchase the products to burn calories, not their skin," the women's lawyers said.

308.title: Loudspeaker banned not Azaan, people free to follow their religion: BJP's Shahnawaz
308.article_body: Speaking on the loudspeaker row, BJP's Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said that some people are spreading the illusion that Azaan is banned but that's not the truth. "There is no ban on Azaan anywhere in the country. People are free to follow their religion," Hussain said. "When Azaan was done for the first time, it was not on loudspeakers," he added.

309.title: Urgent need to take concrete steps to deal with coal crisis: Kejriwal
309.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said there's an urgent need to take concrete steps to deal with the ongoing coal crisis across the country. "There's a huge problem of electricity across the country. Till now in Delhi we have managed in some way," he tweeted. "Together we all have to find a solution to this soon," Kejriwal added.

310.title: Actor Yash refuses multi-crore endorsement deal for paan masala brand
310.article_body: Actor Yash refused a multi-crore endorsement deal for a paan masala and cardamom brand, Exceed Entertainment, the agency that manages endorsement deals for Yash, confirmed. "This is a truly heroic conscience call by Yash, who...declined a deal that was very personally lucrative, in the interest of his fans," Arjun Banerjee, head of talent and new ventures at the agency, said.

311.title: 90-yr-old woman, whose cake was stolen by US soldiers aged 13, gets cake from US Army
311.article_body: The US Army has given a birthday cake to an Italian woman, to replace one that American soldiers stole from her 77 years ago. Meri Mion was 13 when her village of San Pietro, near Vicenza, saw fighting between US troops and German soldiers during World War II. Mion said she would share the replacement cake with her relatives.

312.title: They looked out of the game from the 1st over: Cutting on PBKS' loss vs LSG
312.article_body: Discussing PBKS' loss against LSG by 20 runs, ex-KKR all-rounder Ben Cutting said, "It never looked like PBKS were in the game right from the very first over. They kept losing wickets at regular intervals." "We saw the ball move around when it was new and they could never really come back from there," added Cutting.

313.title: Man held for extorting money from property dealer in Gurugram
313.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly demanding extortion money, amounting to ₹10 crore, from a Gurugram-based property dealer. The suspect, identified as Manoj Kumar, was held at the Rampura flyover on NH-48 at Gurugram Sector 78 on Friday, police said. Notably, the complainant had alleged that an unidentified person was demanding extortion money through text messages and WhatsApp calls.

314.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark worldwide, becomes 4th Indian movie to do so
314.article_body: Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark worldwide, becoming the fourth Indian movie to do so. The Prashanth Neel-directorial was released on April 14. Other Indian films to cross ₹1,000-crore mark globally are 'RRR', 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

315.title: His shot was the worst: Sehwag on PBKS' Livingstone's dismissal vs LSG
315.article_body: Talking about PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's dismissal in his team's defeat against LSG by 20 runs, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "Livingstone's shot was the worst. You can hit sixes down the ground...but why get out trying to hit unorthodox shots." "Had he played even normal cricket, PBKS would have won the match with an over to spare," added Sehwag.

316.title: BHU student shaves head outside VC residence in protest against Iftar party
316.article_body: A Banaras Hindu University (BHU) student on Friday tonsured his head outside Vice-Chancellor's residence in protest against the Iftar party organised in the Women's College inside the campus. The agitation will continue until the VC apologises for organising the Iftar party, protesting students said. BHU is being radicalised with Islam and hence it became necessary to purify VC, students added.

317.title: Punjab govt transfers Patiala Inspector General of Police, SSP after violent clashes
317.article_body: After the violent clashes in Patiala, Punjab government has transferred Patiala Inspector General of Police (IG), Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) and Superintendent of Police (SP) with immediate effect. "Mukhwinder Singh Chhina has been appointed as new IG, Deepak Parik appointed as new SSP and Wazir Singh has been appointed as new SP," a spokesperson of Chief Minister's Office said.

318.title: Not much difference between governance of Yogi, Mamata: Cong leader
318.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said there is not much difference between the governance of UP CM Yogi Adityanath and that of Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "Both...have failed in maintaining a law and order situation," Chowdhury added. His reaction came after Mamata Banerjee said she will not let West Bengal become Hathras or Unnao amid recent rape cases.

319.title: T'gana CM KCR hosts Iftar party; leaders including Owaisi attend
319.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday hosted an Iftar party at Hyderabad's LB Stadium on behalf of the state government which was attended by several leaders, including AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi. "It's easy to destroy something, but very difficult to build or develop...ultimate victory belongs to humanity," Rao said. The CM's Office shared pictures of the event on Twitter.

320.title: Hanuman Chalisa arrests would've hurt Bal Thackeray's soul: Choubey
320.article_body: Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey on Friday claimed that people being arrested over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa or taking Lord Ram's name would have "hurt the soul" of late Shiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray. He added that loudspeakers shouldn't be used late at night or early in the morning. "People are facing...problems due to noise pollution," he further said.

321.title: Balcony of 2-storey building collapses in Telangana; 4 killed
321.article_body: Four people were killed and one injured after the balcony on the first floor of a two-storey building collapsed in Telangana's Yadagirigutta on Friday. The building has houses as well as shops. "The sudden collapse of the building caused injuries to those in the shops and the passers-by on the road," police said. The building is reportedly three-and-a-half decades old.

322.title: Jaideep increases his acting fee for 'Paatal Lok 2', charges ₹20 crore: Report
322.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat has reportedly increased his acting fee for the upcoming season of the crime-thriller series 'Paatal Lok'. "While the actor was paid a nominal amount of ₹40 lakh for...first season, his salary has gone up by 50 times for...second season. He's paid a handsome sum of ₹20 crore for season two of Paatal Lok," a source told Pinkvilla.

323.title: CBI arrests Central GST Superintendent, Inspector for taking bribe
323.article_body: A Central GST Superintendent and an Inspector were arrested by the CBI in Kolhapur's Jaysingpur for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹50,000. The accused have been identified as Mahesh Nesarikar (Superintendent) and Amit Kumar Mishra (Inspector). According to the CBI, the bribe was allegedly demanded from the complainant to settle a matter regarding the latter's service tax liability.

324.title: Introducing realme GT NEO 3 with world's fastest 150W charging: realme
324.article_body: realme announced the launch of realme GT NEO 3 on April 29. Priced at ₹29,999* this is the world's first and fastest 150W charging flagship which gives you 50% charge in just 5 minutes, the brand revealed, adding that the Dimensity 8100 5G processor makes it realme's first dedicated display processor. The sale begins on May 4 at noon.

325.title: Musk sells 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 bn in a week
325.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold a total of 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion this week. He offloaded about 4.4 million shares on April 26 and April 27. He sold an additional 5.2 million shares on April 28, new filings on Friday showed. The latest string of sales follows announcement of Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal.

326.title: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli buys Volvo XC40 worth ₹44.5 lakh, pic surfaces
326.article_body: SS Rajamouli recently bought a Volvo XC40 which is worth ₹44.50 lakh. A picture of the filmmaker receiving the car keys was shared online. Other than Volvo XC40, Rajamouli reportedly also has a Land Rover Range Rover and BMW 7 Series in his garage. Rajamouli's latest film 'RRR', starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR, earned more than ₹1,000 crore globally.

327.title: India reports 3,688 COVID-19 cases, 2,755 recoveries in last 24 hours
327.article_body: India reported 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 2,755 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 2,496 recoveries. Active cases in India stand at 18,684, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,803.

328.title: Fighter pilot 'Ghost of Kyiv' killed in Ukraine war; identity revealed
328.article_body: Ukrainian fighter pilot known as 'Ghost of Kyiv' has been killed in the war in the country, Mayor of Kolomyia, Bogdan Stanislavsky announced. After his death, the identity of the pilot was revealed as Major Stepan Tarabalka, 29. Tarabalka lost his life when the MiG-29 he was flying was shot down while battling "overwhelming" enemy forces, Stanislavsky said.

329.title: Theft of Pakistani music continues: Singer Hadiqa on Kanika's 'Boohey Barian' rendition
329.article_body: After singer Kanika Kapoor released her rendition of 'Boohey Barian', Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani took to Instagram and said, "Another day and another shameless rendition of the song my mother wrote." "I am alive and well, if you want [to] sing my songs, ask me first," she added. She further wrote, "The theft of Pakistani music continues."

330.title: Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time: Shubman Gill to Elon Musk
330.article_body: Addressing the world's richest person Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, cricketer Shubman Gill tweeted, "Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time. @elonmusk #swiggy." Reacting to his tweet, Swiggy Cares wrote, "Hi Shubman Gill. Twitter or no Twitter...we just want to make sure all is well with your orders (that is if you're ordering)."

331.title: Over $200 billion wiped off Amazon’s market value in its biggest 1-day drop since 2006
331.article_body: Amazon stock sank 14% in its biggest one-day drop since July 2006, with the shares closing on Friday at their lowest level since June 2020. With this, more than $200 billion was wiped off from the company's market valuation. This comes after the e-commerce giant reported quarterly loss for the first time in seven years.

332.title: Threads soaked in heroin worth ₹450 crore seized from Gujarat port; govt shares pic
332.article_body: Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence have recovered nearly 90 kilogram of heroin worth ₹450 crore from a shipping container that arrived at the Pipavav port in Amreli district from Iran. Threads were soaked in a solution containing heroin, which were then dried, made into bales and packed in bags for export, said Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia.

333.title: Delhi records second hottest April in 72 years: IMD
333.article_body: Delhi in 2022 recorded its second hottest April in 72 years, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Friday. The average maximum temperature during the month in the national capital stood at 40.2°C. Notably, Delhi on Thursday witnessed its warmest April day in 12 years amid heatwave, with the Safdarjung observatory recording a maximum temperature of 43.5°C, PTI reported.

334.title: It will spread a good message: AIMIM leader on inviting Raj Thackeray for Iftaar
334.article_body: AIMIM leader and Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel invited Raj Thackeray for an Iftaar party and said, "It will spread a good message in the country." "MNS chief Raj Thackeray is coming here for a rally on May 1. I invite him for Iftaar," he said. Jaleel further added that 99% of people are peace-loving, only 1% of people create disturbance.

335.title: Bengaluru records hottest day of the year on April 29 at 35.2°C
335.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed hottest day of the year on Friday (April 29) with city's maximum temperature touching 35.2°C. "This is not a heatwave as the temperature is just 1-2°C  above normal. For a heatwave, maximum temperature should be at least 4.5°C  above normal," IMD officials said. Bengaluru is expected to receive scattered rainfall in the coming days, IMD said.

336.title: Mobile internet services to be suspended from 9:30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today
336.article_body: Mobile internet services will be suspended from 9.30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today, according to an order by Principal Secretary, Home Affairs & Justice, Anurag Verma. This comes amid tensions after the violent clash between two groups in Patiala. Patiala Deputy Commissioner and SSP said that the data services could be grossly misused by certain unscrupulous elements.

337.title: If you don't speak Hindi leave this country and go: Sanjay Nishad
337.article_body: Responding to a media query about the ongoing language debate in the country, Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad said that Hindustan is not a place for people who don't speak Hindi. "They should leave this country and go somewhere else," he said. "If you do not love Hindi, it will be assumed that you are a foreigner," he added.

338.title: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation clears ₹1,417 crore budget
338.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation's executive committee cleared their proposed budget, which has an expenditure of ₹1,417 crore, for the 2022-23 financial year in a meeting on Friday. The total budget expenditure will be spent on various civic segments including cleaning, streetlights and water supply, and the effective expenditure for 2022-23 will be around ₹900 crore, GMC officials said.

339.title: Husband stabs wife at TN court ahead of divorce hearing; arrested
339.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly attempting to murder his wife by stabbing her multiple times outside a court in Tamil Nadu's Perambalur on Friday. The accused and his wife, who got married 19 years ago, had filed an appeal to get divorced and were appearing for the hearing. The wife was taken to a government hospital for treatment.

340.title: Delhi HC grants ₹15 lakh to victim 25 yrs after Connaught Place shooting
340.article_body: Delhi High Court granted compensation of ₹15 lakh to a victim who was injured in the 1997 Connaught Place shooting. The injury due to state action needs to be considered at a "higher standard" than ordinary cases of negligence, HC said. The victim and his two friends were travelling in a car when a shootout involving Delhi Police took place.

341.title: Hyderabad's Alair Police Station adjudged best in T'gana, 5th in country
341.article_body: The Alair Police Station under Hyderabad's Rachakonda Commissionerate has been adjudged the best police station in Telangana by the Union Ministry of Home Affairs. It also ranked fifth among the top 75 police stations in the country. "The Telangana Police force has been striving to provide impeccable services to...citizens round the clock," Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat said.

342.title: Swiggy to pilot use of drones for Instamart deliveries
342.article_body: Swiggy has said it will pilot the use of drones for its online grocery service, Instamart, starting May. The drones will be used to replenish stocks between seller-run dark stores and from a store to a common customer point. The orders will then be picked by delivery partners who will deliver them to the customers.

343.title: 28-year-old woman killed in a hit-and-run accident in Pune
343.article_body: A woman (28) was killed in a road accident at Dukkar Khind in Pune's Warje area on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Priyanka Ankush Mahajan, was riding a two-wheeler when she was hit by an unidentified vehicle which later fled the spot, police said. Notably, Mahajan was on her way to a job interview when the hit-and-run accident took place.

344.title: HC denies Labour Day procession request over traffic jams in B'luru
344.article_body: Karnataka High Court has denied a request by unions to hold a procession on the occasion of International Labour Day on May 1 in Bengaluru. The court said that a procession of 15,000 people on a Sunday during daytime would cause traffic congestion. The procession would have reportedly taken place from City Railway Station or Town Hall to Freedom Park.

345.title: Gold price dips as dollar climbs to 20-year high
345.article_body: Gold price extended loss for second successive week, logging biggest monthly drop in April since September 2021. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold rate for June contract closed at ₹51,760 per 10 gram mark on Friday. As per experts, the dip came as dollar index sustained above 100 for entire week leading to USD climbing to 20-year high levels.

346.title: Bombay HC allows 2 death row convicts to pursue studies in jail
346.article_body: The Bombay High Court allowed two convicts in the case of Kopardi rape and murder of minor to pursue their studies through open university while in prison. The HC bench said that the convicts' desire to pursue education was "welcome" and directed the prison authorities to "adopt a humanitarian approach", and "extend necessary assistance" to help them pursue their studies.

347.title: 2 policemen demand ₹5,000 bribe over bail request in Pune; booked
347.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau has booked two police officers for allegedly demanding ₹5,000 as a bribe from a woman who was helping her colleague get bail. The accused were identified as sub-inspector Suresh Pundalik Gite and havaldar Santosh Sathe and are from the Shirur police station. The woman's colleague is booked in a criminal case.

348.title: Lemonade seller beaten to death after he uses 'stale' lemons in Ghaziabad
348.article_body: A lemonade seller was beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad over payment issues following which an e-rickshaw driver was arrested, police said.
