The victim used stale lemons, the accused claimed. A scuffle broke out between the accused, who was with two other persons, and the victim. The lemonade seller was beaten with sticks and stones, his family alleged.

349.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy features on cover of TIME magazine
349.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has featured on the cover of TIME magazine amid the war in his country. The text on the magazine's cover reads, "How Zelenskyy leads: Inside the compound with the President and his team." "People see this war on Instagram, on social media. When they get sick of it, they will scroll away," he said.

350.title: Haryana CM meets Union Power Minister, discusses power supply issue
350.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Union Power Minister RK Singh met and it was agreed that 300 MW from the Kameng Hydro Electric project will be supplied to Haryana. "Haryana has decided to set up a new unit of 750 MW at its Yamuna Nagar plant for which the Ministry of Power will extend...assistance," the ministry's statement said.

351.title: Urge people to not be provoked: Captain Amarinder on Patiala clash
351.article_body: Expressing concerns over the situation in Punjab's Patiala, former CM Captain Amarinder Singh urged people to not get provoked. "People of Patiala are peace-loving...Hope that Punjab Police will take firm action and ensure that law and order are maintained," Captain tweeted. Tension prevailed after Shiv Sena members and pro-Khalistani activists clashed.

352.title: Punjab CM never met me over coal crisis: Union Coal Minister
352.article_body: Reacting to a comment made by AAP MP Raghav Chadha, Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that AAP "has a habit of lying." He added that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann "never met" him to discuss the coal crisis. "They have never met me and they're saying that they have. [They are] taking my name and spreading lies," Joshi said.

353.title: Probe 23-yr-old basketball player's death: Kerala CM to Bihar CM
353.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday wrote a letter to his Bihar counterpart Nitish Kumar seeking "a comprehensive and fair investigation" into the alleged suicide of Lithara. She was a 23-year-old basketball player from Kerala employed in Indian Railways in Patna. The victim's family alleged she was being mentally harassed by her coach and she'd complained to them about it.

354.title: Bihar Police to use AI to nab gangs involved in banned liquor trade
354.article_body: Bihar Police is planning to introduce Artificial intelligence (AI) technology to help officers catch gangs or individuals involved in the banned liquor trade. The AI mechanism will make it "easy to identify...area of operations with real-time analytics and automated processes," police said. The Bihar Prohibition Act, imposed in 2016, bans the manufacture, sale and consumption of liquor.

355.title: LSG defeat PBKS to register their 6th win in IPL 2022, move to 3rd on the points table
355.article_body: LSG defeated PBKS by 20 runs to register their sixth win in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the third position on the points table. PBKS have now lost five matches in the season. Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG in the match with 46(37), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan took three wickets.

356.title: EU border agency chief resigns amid accusations of rights abuse
356.article_body: The head of the European Union's border agency, Frontex, has resigned amid criticism of the treatment of migrants at the borders. Fabrice Leggeri is accused of tolerating illegal "pushbacks" of migrants, which violate the EU's obligations under international humanitarian law that prohibits returning people to where their lives would be at risk. Leggeri had dismissed the accusations in the past.

357.title: Seized heroin appeared in Flipkart packaging: CAIT as it seeks probe against firm
357.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has sought an NCB investigation against Flipkart over its alleged role in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh drug racket busted by the NCB. "The seized heroin and other articles appeared in Flipkart packaging as per video and photos available on media," the CAIT said. "Flipkart's possible involvement in illegal activities...must not go unnoticed," it added.

358.title: Arshdeep should get a chance to play for India vs SA in T20Is: Sehwag
358.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh should be given a chance to play for India in their home T20I series against South Africa in June. "You'll know how he bowls against an international team...he'll get some experience too," he added. Arshdeep, who has taken three wickets so far, has an economy rate of 5.66 at death overs.

359.title: BJP did corruption in J'khand: Congress leader on power crisis
359.article_body: Blaming BJP for the ongoing power crisis in Jharkhand, Congress spokesperson Rakesh Sinha accused the BJP of corruption. "But what have they (BJP) done in these years? They have given nothing in the name of infrastructure to the state," he said. "They kept indulging in corrupt activities instead of providing infrastructure to the state", Sinha added.

360.title: US unlikely to eliminate coronavirus: Anthony Fauci
360.article_body: The coronavirus pandemic is not over and it is unlikely that the US will ever eliminate COVID-19, according to US President Joe Biden's Chief Medical Advisor Anthony Fauci. "By no means is it over. We still are experiencing a global pandemic," he said. Health officials are hoping to reach a point where COVID-19 can be controlled, he added.

361.title: Talks of BJP-MNS alliance are false: Devendra Fadnavis
361.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis dismissed reports of BJP's alliance with Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS). Fadnavis said there was no such proposal. "Yes, Raj Thackeray took issues of loudspeakers...that has been our issue...but alliance talks are false," he said. MNS's Yashwant Killedar also denied reports of an alliance between BJP and MNS.

362.title: 2 men robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint in Punjab's Ludhiana
362.article_body: Two employees of a private firm were robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint on Bhaini Gujra Link road in Ludhiana, Punjab. Ram Singh, who hails from Rajasthan, said that the miscreants injured the duo with sharp-edged weapons and threatened them at gunpoint. The police are scanning the footage of CCTV cameras installed to identify the culprits, sub-inspector Dalwinder Singh said.

363.title: India's peak power demand reaches all-time high of 207 GW amid heatwave
363.article_body: Amid a heatwave in India, the country's energy demand reached an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW (207 GW) at 02.50 pm on Friday, the Power Ministry said. This came after the peak power demand had reached a record 204.65 GW on Thursday. The peak power shortage recorded on Thursday was 10.77 GW.

364.title: It'd be a mistake to imagine Stokes as long-term Eng Test skipper: Atherton
364.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Atherton has said it would be a "mistake" to imagine Ben Stokes as a "long-term" choice for England Test skipper's role. "Having seen the way the job wears down even the toughest and flintiest of characters, there is no need for the same to happen to Stokes," he added. Stokes was appointed as Test captain on Thursday.

365.title: Cong leader meets Azam Khan's family, says 'SP didn’t stand with him'
365.article_body: Congress leader Pramod Krishnam on Thursday met jailed Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan’s family in UP's Rampur and said that SP didn't perform its duty to stand with him. He further urged BJP to reconsider its decisions citing Khan's ill health and said, "We're standing with him and his family. It should be seen from...perspective of humanity and not politics."

366.title: War showed Zelenskyy's true qualities to world: Ukraine Prez's wife
366.article_body: In an interview published on Friday, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska said that the war has revealed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's true qualities to the world. "He has always been a man you can rely on. A man who'll never fail. Who'll hold out until the end," she added. Zelenska revealed she hasn't seen her husband since the conflict began.

367.title: Man shot at while trying to flee from police custody in Assam
367.article_body: A man in Assam's Cachar district, who was recently arrested for robbery, was shot at by police after he allegedly tried to escape. He sustained a bullet injury in his leg and has been admitted to hospital. The incident reportedly took place in Auliyatilla near Silchar town where he had been escorted by police in order to recover stolen motorcycles.

368.title: Who cares how much somebody spends on a house: Sunny on reports of buying ₹16cr house
368.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone, while reacting to reports of spending ₹16 crore on a three-bedroom penthouse in Mumbai, said, "I think it's the media's job to verify and figure out what needs to be put out. Who cares how much somebody spends on a house?" "People sometimes make s**t up just for the heck of it," she added.

369.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes 3rd hundred in 3 county matches
369.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Friday smashed his third hundred in three matches for Sussex in the County Championship Division Two. Pujara is unbeaten on 128 off 198 deliveries after stumps on Day 2 of Sussex's match against Durham. Earlier in the season, Pujara had scored 109 runs against Worcestershire and 201* against Derbyshire.

370.title: First solar eclipse of 2022 to take place on April 30, NASA reveals locations
370.article_body: On April 30, people in some locations will have a chance to witness the first solar eclipse of the year. As it sets, the Sun will appear partially eclipsed in Chile, Argentina, most of Uruguay, western Paraguay, southwestern Bolivia, southeastern Peru and a small area of southwestern Brazil. It'll also be visible along parts of the northwestern coastline of Antarctica.

371.title: World's longest glass-bottomed bridge opens in Vietnam, pics surface
371.article_body: A 632-metre-long glass-bottomed bridge suspended 150 metres (490 feet) above a jungle has opened in Vietnam. The Bach Long ('White Dragon') pedestrian bridge is believed to be the world's longest glass-bottomed bridge and is located in Vietnam's northwest Son La province. Its floor is made from French-manufactured tempered glass, making it strong enough to support 450 people at a time.

372.title: There's nothing agricultural about Rahul's batting in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
372.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul's batting form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the LSG captain has been outstanding. "The best part about Rahul's batting is that nothing is agricultural in his cricketing shots. Every shot that he plays is a proper textbook stroke," he added. With 374 runs from nine matches, Rahul is second-highest run-scorer so far.

373.title: Millions of honeybees die after being left on hot tarmac at US airport
373.article_body: Millions of bees that were set to be shipped to beekeepers across US' Alaska have died after they were left on a hot tarmac in Atlanta. Beekeepers who were waiting for the shipment called it "devastating". A beekeeper waiting for the shipment said that bees had escaped from their crates in the plane, so Delta Airlines had put them outside.

374.title: Elon Musk has lined up a new CEO for Twitter: Report
374.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, has lined up a new CEO for the company, Reuters reported. Musk earlier told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor that he doesn't have confidence in Twitter's management. Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal will reportedly receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

375.title: Ex-US Marine killed fighting alongside Ukrainian forces in Ukraine
375.article_body: Former US Marine Willy Joseph Cancel was killed alongside Ukrainian forces this week, his relatives said, in the first known death of an American fighting in Ukraine. "He wanted to go over because he believed in what Ukraine was fighting for," Rebecca Cabrera, Cancel's mother, said. The US has warned Americans against going to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

376.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Bhutanese counterpart, hands over medical supplies
376.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday met his Bhutanese counterpart Tandi Dorji and handed over medical supplies to him. Jaishankar said, "It's my honour to hand over the 12th consignment of medical supplies to Bhutan, as a gift from the government and people of India to...Bhutan." "We'll continue to stand...by your side through...post-COVID-19 sustainable recovery," he added.

377.title: 2 Chennai auto drivers fined ₹6,100 after abusing woman over fare
377.article_body: Two auto drivers in TN's Chennai, who reportedly abused a woman and her son and threw out their luggage after an argument over fare on Wednesday, have been fined a total of ₹6,100 by police. A passerby had shared a video of the incident on social media following which the city Commissioner directed officers to take action, an officer said.

378.title: 25 swords seized from auto in Maharashtra's Nanded, 2 arrested
378.article_body: Police in Maharashtra's Nanded on Friday recovered 25 swords that were being transported in an autorickshaw. Police had intercepted the auto after receiving information about two persons carrying a consignment of weapons. A boy and the owner of a gift shop were arrested and an investigation is underway. Earlier, police recovered 89 swords and a dagger in Dhule.

379.title: Wipro plans to hire 38,000 freshers in FY23
379.article_body: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company hired over 19,000 freshers in FY22 and expects to double the number in FY23. Wipro added 45,416 employees on a year-on-year basis during the financial year, taking its total headcount to 2,43,128. The company said it plans to increase the frequency of promotion cycle for 70% employees in junior bands to quarterly basis.

380.title: He couldn't even become UP CM: Mayawati on Akhilesh's 'PM' remark
380.article_body: After Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he wanted BSP chief Mayawati to be PM, the latter reacted by saying, "They need to stop making such childish statements." She tweeted, "When (Akhilesh) couldn't fulfil his own dream of becoming (UP CM) even after securing...votes of Muslims and Yadavs...how would he manage to meet someone else's aspiration to become PM."

381.title: Sri Lankan Prez agreed to remove brother as PM: Ex-Prez Sirisena
381.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to remove his older brother Mahinda Rajapaksa as the PM in a proposed interim government to solve a political impasse, ex-President Maithripala Sirisena said on Friday. The impasse was caused by the country's worst economic crisis in decades. The interim government will include all the parties in the Parliament, Sirisena added.

382.title: Bulldozers & swords given to people in name of religion: Mufti
382.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Friday said that people have been 'given bulldozers and swords in the name of religion'. She added that the situation was similar to a neighbouring country which "gave guns to people in name of religion". She further alleged that the Centre was 'pitting Hindus and Muslims against each other to hide job crisis and inflation'.

383.title: Will not do mankad unless the guy is properly cheating: LSG's Stoinis
383.article_body: On being asked if he would 'mankad' the batter, LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he won't do it unless the player is "properly cheating" at the non-strikers end. He added, "I'd probably tell him off first and ask him to stay in the crease." Stoinis has scored 73 runs and taken one wicket in five IPL 2022 matches so far.

384.title: Owaisi breaks down during speech, says 'Muslims are being wiped out'
384.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday broke down while addressing a gathering in Hyderabad and alleged that "Muslims are being wiped out of the country". Speaking on the bulldozer row, Owaisi said that he gets calls every day about the "instances of injustice" happening in India. "One shouldn't lose hope...We'll face it with patience but will never raze...home," he added.

385.title: Statehood demand for North Bengal justified: BJP MLA amid heatwave
385.article_body: Condemning West Bengal government's decision to announce early summer vacations in schools due to heatwave, BJP MLA Sankar Ghosh said the demand for separate statehood for North Bengal was "justified". He called North Bengal's weather "moderately pleasant". The "step-motherly" treatment of the TMC government towards North Bengal has led to this demand, he added.

386.title: Curfew imposed in Punjab's Patiala till 6 am tomorrow after 2 groups clash
386.article_body: Local authorities have imposed an 11-hour curfew in Punjab's Patiala after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena on Friday. The curfew, which was imposed from 7 pm, will remain in force till 6 am on Saturday. According to Patiala SSP, four persons, including two police personnel, have sustained injuries in the incident.

387.title: India's economy may take up to 13 years to recover from COVID-19 losses: RBI
387.article_body: India is expected to overcome the losses caused by the COVID-19 disruptions by 2034-35, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated in its report on currency and financing released on Friday. It further stated, "India suffered among the biggest pandemic induced losses in the world in terms of output, lives and livelihoods...Economic activity has barely recovered...even after two years."

388.title: Nobody else is bowling at 150 kmph in world right now: Steyn on SRH's Umran
388.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said the franchise's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik will undoubtedly play for Team India in future as he's bowling at 150 kmph consistently in IPL 2022. "Nobody else is doing that in the world right now," he added. "I'm just trying to pat him on the shoulder and...encourage him when he bowls well," he further said.

389.title: Pregnant woman forced to drink toilet cleaner by husband in Telangana, dies
389.article_body: A pregnant woman in Telangana's Nizamabad district died on Wednesday after her husband forced her to drink toilet cleaner. The accused is on the run and police have formed teams to catch him. The woman's family members lodged a complaint against the accused and his family members alleging that they had harassed her for additional dowry.

390.title: MP-MLA couple's intent was to challenge law and order: Mumbai Police
390.article_body: Mumbai Police today opposed the bail pleas of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana. Police claimed the couple's announcement to recite Hanuman Chalisa in front of CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence was with an intention to challenge law and order. Their acts were part of the larger conspiracy to get Maha Vikas Aghadi government dissolved, police added.

391.title: 182 COVID-19 cases reported at IIT Madras campus so far as 11 more test +ve
391.article_body: Eleven more persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of infected people to 182, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan informed on Friday. Radhakrishnan added that the campus hasn't been closed yet and government and campus authorities are trying to ensure that the COVID-19 cluster does not spread to other places.

392.title: 50 killed in a blast after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan
392.article_body: An explosion killed more than 50 worshippers after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan's Kabul, the head of the mosque said. The attack came as worshippers at the Sunni mosque gathered after Friday prayers for a congregation. Several mosques and cities are being targeted in Afghanistan during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

393.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal activists recite Hanuman Chalisa in support of temple in Agra
393.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal activists on Friday recited the Hanuman Chalisa at the office of the Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) of North Central Railway's Agra division in Uttar Pradesh. As per reports, the activists were opposing any move to shift the Chamunda Devi temple from the platform of the Raja Ki Mandi railway station in the city.

394.title: Hindi is a link language: K'taka minister on nat'l language debate
394.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's exchange over the national language, Karnataka minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan said, "Hindi is nothing but a link language." He said, "We need to love our language and at the same time, respect other languages and coexist." We are here to promote the local language as it is our identity, he added.

395.title: Putin, Zelenskyy accept Indonesia's invites to attend G20 summit
395.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy have accepted Indonesia's invites to G20 summit in November, amid calls by US and its allies to remove Russia from the grouping. Indonesia, the current chair of the G20, said that the war in Ukraine has impacted the recovery of the global economy. Notably, Ukraine is not a G20 member.

396.title: I’m not a major fan of it in all honesty: Russell on F1 sprint races
396.article_body: Mercedes' George Russell said he is "not a major fan" of F1 sprint races after the first sprint race of the season at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. There are three sprint races scheduled for this season, with a push by several teams to double that to six sprint races. Russell added sprint races should "probably be 50% longer".

397.title: BJP wants to create disturbance over louspeaker issue: Sanjay Raut
397.article_body:
Accusing the BJP of creating disturbance over the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra,
Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the BJP opposed an all-party meet called by the state government to discuss the issue. "[This] means you (BJP) want to do politics and want to create a disturbance on the matter of loudspeakers in [Maharashtra]," Sanjay Raut said.

398.title: Man Utd interim boss Rangnick appointed as Austria head coach
398.article_body: Manchester United on Friday said interim boss Ralf Rangnick has been appointed as the head coach of the Austrian national football team. United said Rangnick will join the national team at the end of May after the 2021-22 Premier League season ends. The club added Rangnick, 63, "will combine the job with his consultancy role at Old Trafford as planned."

399.title: Thousands take part in anti-Israel rallies on Jerusalem Day in Iran
399.article_body: Thousands of Iranians on Friday took part in rallies in Iran to mark the "Quds Day" (Jerusalem Day) for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began. The day, being marked since 1979, is a way of showing support for the Palestinians. The demonstrators chanted "Death to Israel" and "Death to America" at the rally.

400.title: I think it should be Sanskrit: Kangana Ranaut on national language debate
400.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while speaking on the national language debate, said, "If you ask me which language should be the national language, then I think it should be Sanskrit." "Sanskrit is older than Kannada, Tamil, Gujarati or Hindi. All these languages have come from Sanskrit. Then why hasn't Sanskrit become the national language?" she added.
